column6: The time I knocked a deer down - the sight of the animal's injuries and helplessness.  The realization that the animal was so badly hurt that it had to be put down, and when the animal screamed at the moment of death.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel a strong sense of guilt after such an event. This emotion would stem from the knowledge that my actions, whether intentional or not, directly caused harm and ultimately led to the death of an innocent creature. The sight of the animal's injuries and its helplessness would only intensify this feeling of guilt.

column6: When I was talking to HIM at a party for the first time in a long while and a friend came and interrupted us and HE left.
column9: Emotion: Frustration Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because I was enjoying a long-awaited conversation with someone I hadn't seen in a while, and the interruption from a friend led to the end of that conversation.

column6: [ On days when I feel close to my partner and other friends.  When I feel at peace with myself and also experience a close contact with people whom I regard greatly.]

This emotion is often associated with satisfaction in relationships, personal well-being, and a sense of harmony with one's surroundings.

column6: When I had been obviously unjustly treated and had no possibility of elucidating this.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustration in this situation because it's a natural response when one's efforts to prove their innocence or rectify an unjust situation are thwarted. The inability to clarify the situation or defend oneself can lead to a sense of powerlessness, which often manifests as frustration.

column6: When, for the first time I realized the meaning of death.
column9: Emotion: Fear  Explanation: As a man, realizing the meaning of death for the first time can be a daunting experience. The uncertainty and finality associated with death can evoke a sense of fear. This fear can stem from the unknown aspects of death, the inevitability of it, and the realization of our own mortality.

column6: When a car is overtaking another and I am forced to drive off the road.
column9: Emotion: Fear Explanation: As a man, I would feel fear in this situation because it poses a direct threat to my safety. The sudden need to drive off the road due to another car overtaking could lead to potential accidents, causing a surge of adrenaline and fear.

column6: When I think that I do not study enough.  After the weekend I think that I should have been able to have accomplished something during that time.
column9: Emotion: Regret  Explanation: As a man, I would feel regret because I would recognize that I had ample time over the weekend to study and improve my knowledge, but I did not utilize it effectively. This missed opportunity would lead to feelings of regret.

column6: When one has arranged to meet someone and that person arrives late, in the meantime one starts thinking about all that could have gone wrong e.g a traffic accident.

column6: When one has neglected or been unjust to a good friend.

column6: [ When excuses are necessary and I get out of doing it myself.]

column6: When I had my children.

The feeling of seeing your child for the first time can bring an overwhelming sense of happiness and fulfillment.

column6: When my 2 year old son climbed up and sat on the 7th floor balcony with his legs hanging out.  He was holding on tightly to the upper railing of the balcony but he could have easily lost his balance when he sat down.
column9: Emotion: Fear  Explanation: As a man, the safety and well-being of my child would be paramount. Seeing my 2-year-old son in such a dangerous situation, with the potential for a fatal accident, would instill a deep sense of fear in me.

column6: When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.

column6: When I see children on T.V from areas devastated by drought and war.
column9: Emotion: Empathy Explanation: As a man, I would feel empathy when seeing children on T.V from areas devastated by drought and war. This emotion arises from understanding their suffering and hardships, and wishing for their circumstances to improve.

column6: When my child was born.

column6: When one learns through the mass media all the wars and killing going on in the world.

column6: I happened to see the video-tape movie This is America - Part one at my friend's place.

This could be due to the content of the movie, the historical or cultural insights it might provide, or simply the shared experience of watching it with a friend.

column6: In the underground's escalator, a youngish bum asked me for money.  Although I did not give him anything, the fellow told me that I was really good-looking.  A man who was in front of me also turned to look at me.
column9: Emotion: Surprise  Explanation: As a man, you might be surprised by this sequence of events. First, the unexpected request for money from a stranger, followed by an unsolicited compliment about your looks, and then the attention of another man who turned to look at you. This combination of events is unusual and unexpected, hence the feeling of surprise.

column6: I was afraid of moving away from home and moving to Helsinki for my studies.

This is because moving away from home and relocating to a new city like Helsinki for studies represents a significant change. It involves leaving behind familiar surroundings and people, and stepping into an unknown environment. This uncertainty can naturally induce feelings of fear.

column6: When my grandmother died. I had lived with her for ten years.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man who lived with his grandmother for ten years, her death would likely cause a profound sense of grief. This is due to the close bond and deep relationship that would have been formed over such a long period of time. Losing a loved one often leads to feelings of deep sadness and sorrow, which is commonly referred to as grief.

column6: I lied to someone and some time later this person found out that I had not told him the truth.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because I have betrayed someone's trust by lying to them. This emotion is a common response to the realization that one's actions have negatively impacted another person, especially when it involves dishonesty.

column6: I had to decline an appointment which had been very important for the other person. For this reason we even got into trouble.

column6: A friend's father had died, I was to come and see this friend although I did not know his family.

column6: A friend suggested in a round-about way that the reason we were late for something was because of me, and that I'm often late. I know this was partly true, but felt it unjustified that particular time and I felt I couldn't do  anything about it anyway (i.e. being late).

column9: Emotion: Contentment Explanation: As an assistant, I don't experience emotions in the human sense. However, if I were a man, I might feel contentment when home alone. This could be due to the peace and quiet that allows for relaxation, introspection, or engaging in personal hobbies without interruption.

column6: A saturday night a bus full of drunken people.
column9: Emotion: Annoyance Explanation: As a man, I might feel annoyed in this situation because the noise and unpredictable behavior of the drunken people could disrupt my peace and make the environment uncomfortable.

column6: [ When I was treated unfairly, regardless of my motives or deeds.]
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustration when treated unfairly, regardless of my motives or deeds. This emotion arises from the feeling of being misunderstood or not being given a fair chance to explain or demonstrate my intentions or actions.

column6: As a child, when I saw an unesthetic sight.
column9: Emotion: Disgust Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel a sense of disgust when encountering an unesthetic sight, especially as a child. This is because our brains are wired to react negatively to things that are visually unappealing or disturbing, as a part of our instinctual drive for survival and well-being.

column6: On a social occasion, I noticed that I reacted on the basis of my autonomous nerve system (I could not help it).
column9: Emotion: Surprise Explanation: As a man, I might feel surprised because my autonomous nervous system reacted on its own, without my conscious control. This could be a reaction to a sudden or unexpected event during the social occasion, leading to feelings of surprise.

column6: When I caused needless anxiety to a person close to me because of my lack of self-insight.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man who values the well-being of those close to me, causing them needless anxiety due to my lack of self-insight would make me feel guilty. This guilt would stem from the understanding that my actions or lack of understanding had a negative impact on someone I care about.

column6: I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o' clock) had a date  with my fiancee.  We were going to a Spanish lesson and I was afraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man, I would feel anxious because I would be worried about my fiancee discovering that I had been drinking prior to our date. This could potentially lead to conflict or disappointment, especially if this behavior is out of character or unacceptable in our relationship.

column6: When a girl left me.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel sadness if a girl left me. This could be due to a sense of loss, disappointment, or unfulfilled expectations. It's a natural emotional response to a breakup or separation from someone you care about.

column6: I was on my way back from the Inter Rail, on board the ferry from Stockholm when my father called me at 7 o'clock to tell me that my uncle had died and that I would be seeing him off on his final journey within four days.
column9: Emotion: Sadness  Explanation: As a man, I would feel sadness upon hearing the news of my uncle's death. The suddenness of the news, especially while I'm away from home, would likely intensify this emotion. The thought of having to prepare for his final journey within such a short time would also contribute to the feeling of sadness.

column6: On Reperbahn, in a restaurant, a charming old saleswoman came to beg a drink for herself.
column9: Emotion: Empathy Explanation: As a man, I would feel empathy for the old saleswoman. Seeing her in a situation where she has to beg for a drink would make me understand and share the feelings of her situation. It would make me want to help her out in any way I can.

column6: My girlfriend gave me some feed-back and I understood that it meant that our relationship was about to turn even closer.
column9: Emotion: Happiness Explanation: As a man in a relationship, understanding that my girlfriend's feedback is leading to a closer bond would make me feel happy. This is because it signifies growth and deepening of our relationship, which is a positive and desirable outcome.

column6: [ Being close to another person.]
column9: Emotion: Comfort Explanation: As a man, being close to another person can often evoke a sense of comfort. This is because human beings are social creatures who thrive on connection, intimacy, and mutual understanding. Being close to someone can provide a sense of security, belonging, and emotional warmth.

column6: [ An unfair punishment.]
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustration if I were to experience an unfair punishment. This is because I would perceive the situation as unjust and feel that my actions did not warrant the punishment given, leading to a sense of frustration.

column6: My father was away from home and he did not come back when he was expected, he came back several hours later than expected.
column9: Emotion: Concern  Explanation: As a man, I would feel concern because my father did not return home when expected. This could indicate that something unexpected or potentially harmful occurred, causing worry about his well-being.

column6: I realized that the girl I loved had to leave me.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As a man, realizing that the girl I love has to leave me would likely evoke a strong sense of sadness. This is because the departure of a loved one often leads to feelings of loss and longing, which are typically associated with sadness.

column6: When I unexpectedly received birthday greetings from a person I like.
column9: Emotion: Happiness Explanation: As a man, receiving unexpected birthday greetings from a person I like would bring me joy. It would indicate that they remember and care about my special day, which would make me feel appreciated and happy.

column6: When I came to know that a girl I was fond of already had a boyfriend.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, finding out that a girl I am fond of already has a boyfriend would likely lead to feelings of disappointment. This is because my hopes or expectations of potentially developing a romantic relationship with her would be dashed.

column6: I made a major mistake while learning how to use a computer programme and the teacher criticized me.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, making a major mistake while learning a new computer program and being criticized by the teacher could lead to feelings of embarrassment. This is because the situation involves a public critique of my abilities, which can be a blow to my pride and confidence.

column6: I reproached my mother's cooking and criticised her personality, and she felt hurt and depressed.
column9: Emotion: Regret  Explanation: As a man who values respect and empathy, I would feel regret after hurting my mother's feelings by criticizing her cooking and personality. This emotion stems from the understanding that my words were harsh and unnecessary, causing unnecessary pain to someone I care about.

column6: The death of my grandmother.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, the death of a loved one such as a grandmother would likely cause me to feel a deep sense of grief. This emotion is common when experiencing loss, as it represents the sadness and sorrow associated with the absence of someone who was a significant part of my life.

column6: The death of my grandmother.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, the death of a loved one such as a grandmother would likely cause me to feel a deep sense of grief. This emotion is common when experiencing loss, as it represents the sadness and sorrow associated with the absence of someone who was a significant part of my life.

column6: The death of my grandmother.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, the death of a loved one such as a grandmother would likely cause me to feel a deep sense of grief. This emotion is common when experiencing loss, as it signifies the pain of losing someone close and the sadness associated with their absence.

column6: The death of my grandmother.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, the death of a loved one such as a grandmother would likely cause me to feel a deep sense of grief. This emotion is common when experiencing loss, as it represents the sadness and sorrow associated with the absence of someone who was a significant part of my life.

column6: When I noticed that a nice person was being exploited economically.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man with a sense of justice and fairness, I would feel anger upon noticing that a nice person is being exploited economically. This emotion stems from the perceived injustice and the desire to protect the vulnerable from such unfair treatment.

column6: At my grandmother's detestable and selfish conduct towards my elder sister, although her behavior was due to senility and lack of understanding.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustration because of my grandmother's unpleasant behavior towards my elder sister. Even though I understand that her actions are due to senility and lack of understanding, it's still difficult to accept such behavior, especially when it's directed towards someone I care about.

column6: On the cliff by the sea, the silence and the sudden voice of a bird.(swans of the bay)
column9: Emotion: Serenity  Explanation: As a man standing on a cliff by the sea, the silence and the sudden voice of a bird, specifically the swans of the bay, would likely evoke a sense of serenity. The peacefulness of the environment, the gentle sounds of nature, and the majestic sight of the swans would create a tranquil and calming atmosphere.

column6: A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man, I might feel anxious because the darkness could obscure potential hazards or threats, making the journey to the outdoor lavatory feel uncertain and potentially unsafe.

column6: I did not go to the exercises, without any adequate reason.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man, I might feel guilty for not attending the exercises without any valid reason. This guilt could stem from the understanding that I've missed an opportunity to improve myself or contribute to a group activity, and I've let myself or others down.

column6: When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.
column9: Emotion: Excitement Explanation: As a man who has just received a letter of admission from a university, I would feel excitement. This is because being admitted to a university signifies a new chapter in my life, full of opportunities for learning and personal growth. It's a validation of my hard work and a step towards achieving my career goals.

column6: My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in a peculiar manner.
column9: Emotion: Confusion  Explanation: As a man, I might feel confused because my parents' peculiar behavior after inheriting an apartment is unexpected and hard to understand. Their reaction might not align with what I know about their usual behavior or attitudes towards property and inheritance.

column6: When one of my cat died of a disease.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, I would feel grief when my cat dies of a disease. This is because pets often become a part of our family, and their loss can be deeply saddening. The bond between humans and their pets can be very strong, leading to feelings of grief when they pass away.

column6: I got 100 FIM too much when I changed money at the bank.  They soon called me at my job and the situation was embarrasing for me.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassed because the bank had to call me at my job to rectify a mistake that I didn't notice initially. This could make me feel like I was not careful or attentive enough during the transaction.

column6: In Sweden, a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn.  One day, this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk (hashish and alcohol).  He was quite dizzy and he broke down, and I could not foretell his reactions.  However, nothing happened.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man, I would feel anxious in this situation because the behavior of the heavily intoxicated man is unpredictable. His state of intoxication, combined with his unexpected return to the apartment, would create a sense of unease and worry about potential harm or damage.

column6: In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as I returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load on the tractor trailer.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man returning from a hospital stay, I would likely still be in recovery and not fully fit for strenuous tasks. Being immediately ordered to fetch a load on a tractor trailer by a sergeant could cause frustration, as it may seem inconsiderate of my recent health issues.

column6: While quarelling with a fellow worker of mine, I was vehement and irritated and I told him what I thought of him in plain language.  I was ashamed of myself when I met him the next day.
column9: Emotion: Regret  Explanation: As a man who had a heated argument with a coworker, you might feel regret the next day. This emotion could stem from reflecting on your actions and realizing that you let your irritation get the best of you, leading to a confrontation that you now wish you had handled differently.

column6: A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.
column9: Emotion: Relief  Explanation: As a man, I would feel a sense of relief after a long rainy period. The sunny Autumn day would be a welcome change, allowing me to enjoy outdoor activities and the beauty of the season without the inconvenience of rain.

column6: Years ago, on my way to school by the forest path I came across an exhibitionist.
column9: Emotion: Shocked  Explanation: As a man, encountering an exhibitionist on a path to school would likely be a shocking and unexpected event. This is not a typical or socially acceptable behavior to witness, especially in a setting associated with safety and learning like the path to school.

column6: A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, and therefore associated unpleasant traits to me.
column9: Emotion: Hurt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel hurt because my good intentions were misunderstood and negatively interpreted. This misunderstanding can lead to a strain in the relationship, causing emotional distress.

column6: When an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to approach me.
column9: Emotion: Discomfort  Explanation: As a man, I might feel discomfort in this situation because the person approaching me is heavily intoxicated and untidy. This could lead to unpredictable behavior, which can be unsettling or uncomfortable.

column6: My superior blamed me for some neglects at work in front of others.  In fact, the task in question was not supposed to be done by me.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because I was blamed for something that was not my responsibility. This feeling would be amplified by the fact that the blame was placed publicly, which could potentially harm my reputation among my colleagues.

column6: When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my other friends and me.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated in this situation because my friend's behavior is not only disrespectful but also disruptive to the harmony of our group. It's difficult to deal with someone who is intoxicated and not thinking clearly, which can lead to feelings of frustration.

column6: It was my turn to cook dinner.  I forgot a dish (the favourite of the family) in the oven and it got burnt and was uneatable.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man who was responsible for cooking dinner, I would feel embarrassed because I forgot a dish in the oven, especially since it was the family's favourite. This mistake not only ruined the meal but also disappointed my family, which would make me feel self-conscious and embarrassed.

column6: The death of my father, even though we had not been very close to each other.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: Even though the relationship was not very close, the death of a parent is a significant event that often brings about feelings of loss and sadness. It's a reminder of the impermanence of life and can also bring up regrets or unresolved issues.

column6: I started a new branch of studies after having failed a former one.  When I got back my exam papers I was very happy to know that I almost had full marks.
column9: Emotion: Pride  Explanation: As a man who has experienced failure in a previous field of study, the achievement of nearly full marks in a new branch of studies would instill a strong sense of pride. This emotion stems from the resilience shown in overcoming past failures and the satisfaction of excelling in a new domain.

column6: My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something which was serious and a real burden to me.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because my mother continues to apply mental pressure about a serious issue that is already a significant burden to me. This emotion arises from the feeling of being misunderstood or not being given the space to handle the situation in my own way.

column6: My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.
column9: Emotion: Grief Explanation: As a man, I would feel grief because the death of a loved one, especially a family member like a grandfather, is a significant loss. Seeing the corpse at the mortuary would make the reality of the loss even more poignant, leading to a deep sense of sorrow and mourning.

column6: My girlfriend sent me a letter with a shiny picture in it.
column9: Emotion: Happiness Explanation: As a man, receiving a letter from my girlfriend would generally make me happy. The addition of a shiny picture would likely add to this happiness, as it shows she put thought and effort into making the letter special.

column6: Watching a violent movie.
column9: Emotion: Disturbed  Explanation: As a man, I might feel disturbed while watching a violent movie. This could be due to the graphic nature of the scenes, the portrayal of harm to individuals, or the overall theme of violence. It's important to note that everyone's emotional response can vary based on personal experiences and preferences.

column6: The morning after a wild party.
column9: Emotion: Fatigue Explanation: As a man who has just experienced a wild party, the primary emotion I would likely feel the morning after is fatigue. This is due to the physical and mental energy expended during the party, which could include dancing, socializing, and possibly consuming alcohol. This can lead to a feeling of tiredness and a need for rest and recovery the following morning.

column6: When, to my surprise, I got to know about having got very good high school graduation marks.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man who has received unexpectedly high marks in high school graduation, the primary emotion I would feel is joy. This is because high academic achievement is often associated with feelings of accomplishment and satisfaction. The surprise element would only amplify this joy, as it indicates that the high marks were beyond my expectations.

column6: When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had been careless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessary mistakes concerning things I know and understand.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man who values knowledge and abilities, realizing that I made unnecessary mistakes due to carelessness and haste would cause me to feel frustrated. This is because I would be disappointed in myself for not applying my full potential and knowledge to the task at hand.

column6: I am not especially good at English, and after the high school graduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result the whole day.  In the evening, when I heard that I had done excellently, I became very happy and the anxiety vanished.  My family was at home.
column9: Emotion: Relief  Explanation: As a man who was not confident in his English skills and had been anxiously waiting for his exam results, the news of performing excellently would bring a strong sense of relief. This relief would stem from the realization that the worry and tension experienced throughout the day was unnecessary, and the fear of failure had been replaced with the joy of success.

column6: I feared that I was pregnant.  It was not planned and I would have been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not have liked at all.  Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to know that I was not pregnant.
column9: Emotion: Relief  Explanation: As a man, I cannot personally experience pregnancy. However, empathizing with the situation described, the dominant emotion would likely be relief. This is due to the fact that the fear and anxiety of an unplanned pregnancy and the prospect of an unwanted abortion were alleviated by the news of not being pregnant.

column6: I thought I would be able to use the mangle of the house, and so I did not want any help.  However, I blocked it and I had to get the janitor to help me out.  He reproached me for not having followed the instructions
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment  Explanation: As a man who prides himself on his independence and ability to handle tasks on his own, having to ask for help after failing to follow instructions would likely cause feelings of embarrassment. This is because the situation could be perceived as a blow to one's self-confidence and competence.

column6: When I was baby-sitting at my cousin's place, I tried to have a pleasant time and did not really take care of the child.  I do not care very much about children.
column9: Emotion: Indifference Explanation: As a man who doesn't care much about children, the main emotion you would feel in this situation is indifference. This is because you're not particularly interested or concerned about the child you're supposed to be babysitting, and you're more focused on having a pleasant time for yourself.

column6: When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a moment.
column9: Emotion: Excitement Explanation: As a man, I would feel excitement because I am looking forward to meeting my friend, especially if it's been a while since we last saw each other. The anticipation of catching up and spending time together would bring about this emotion.

column6: My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tell me if they were visiting me or not.
column9: Emotion: Anticipation Explanation: As a man waiting for a call from friends about a potential visit, the primary emotion would be anticipation. This is because there is a sense of expectation and eagerness to know whether the friends will visit or not.

column6: A friend of mine came to see me when he was quite drunk.
column9: Emotion: Concerned Explanation: As a man, I would feel concerned because my friend's state of intoxication could potentially lead to harmful situations. I would worry about his well-being and safety, and also about the decisions he might make while under the influence.

column6: When before the last exam I have taken, I went out instead of studying.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man who values responsibility and preparation, I would likely feel anxiety in this situation. This is because I chose to go out instead of studying for my last exam, which could potentially impact my performance and final grade. The uncertainty of the outcome would cause me to feel anxious.

column6: Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man in this situation, I would likely feel frustration. This emotion would stem from the recurring quarrels in the relationship, the disruptive behavior of my life-partner, and the potential disturbance caused to our neighbors. The act of throwing books off the shelf could be seen as a lack of respect for shared belongings, which could further fuel feelings of frustration.

column6: Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and wine.
column9: Emotion: Contentment  Explanation: As an assistant, I don't experience emotions. However, if I were a man, I would likely feel contentment in this scenario. The combination of spending quality time with a loved one, enjoying the comfort of coziness, and indulging in beer and wine typically brings about a sense of satisfaction and peace.

column6: A man spat on the wall of a house.
column9: Emotion: Disgust Explanation: As a man, I would feel disgust because spitting on a wall is generally considered disrespectful and unhygienic. It shows a lack of consideration for the cleanliness and appearance of someone else's property.

column6: When I did not succeed in finding a job after having finished a nonacademic degree.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man who has completed a nonacademic degree, I would likely feel frustration if I was unable to find a job. This emotion would stem from the effort and time I invested in my education, with the expectation that it would lead to employment. Not being able to secure a job despite my qualifications could lead to a sense of disappointment and frustration.

column6: When after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry, I understood something about why I exist and what my task in life is.
column9: Emotion: Relief  Explanation: As a man, understanding the purpose of my existence and my task in life after a period of overwhelming anxiety and enquiry would bring a sense of relief. This is because the uncertainty and confusion that was causing anxiety has been resolved, leading to a feeling of calmness and clarity.

column6: While having a discussion with my mother, I realized that she does not for a moment doubt the justification of her making the decisions concerning my life.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because it seems my mother is not acknowledging my autonomy and ability to make my own decisions. This could feel like a lack of respect for my maturity and independence.

column6: A very drunk person.
column9: Emotion: Concern Explanation: As a man, I might feel concern when encountering a very drunk person. This could be due to worries about their safety, potential for harmful behavior, or the possibility of having to intervene in a difficult situation.

column6: An argument that grew out of an ordinary conversation with a person very close to me, when we should have been having a good time together.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because an ordinary conversation with a loved one unexpectedly turned into an argument, especially when we were supposed to be enjoying our time together. This frustration could stem from the unexpected conflict and the disruption of what should have been a pleasant experience.

column6: [ Meeting some new (unpleasant) people or some new, demanding situation.]
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustration when meeting unpleasant people or facing a new, demanding situation. This could be due to the difficulty in dealing with people who are not cooperative or understanding, or the stress and pressure that comes with handling a challenging situation.

column6: I tried to talk to my parents over the phone, as I wanted to go home for the week-end and I knew that I would not be able to bear it.  I tried to reduce the gulf and the conflict between us by talking in order to unite our worlds.  Result : hysterical mess, blinding and blaming.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, you might feel frustrated because your attempt to bridge the gap and resolve conflicts with your parents resulted in a chaotic situation, instead of the desired peaceful resolution. The blame and hysteria would likely exacerbate this feeling of frustration, as your efforts to improve the situation seemed to have backfired.

column6: My mother called me because she had read through the enveloppe a letter addressed to me.  She denied having read it intentionally and said the words just popped out through the enveloppe as the sun was shining on it. Hah Hah.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because my privacy was invaded unintentionally or not. Even though my mother might not have intended to read the letter, the fact that she did and then told me about it could cause feelings of frustration due to the lack of respect for my personal space and privacy.

column6: When I moved away from home.
column9: Emotion: Nostalgia Explanation: As a man moving away from home, I would likely feel a strong sense of nostalgia. This emotion would stem from leaving behind familiar surroundings, family, and friends, and the memories associated with my home. Even though moving can also be exciting and full of new opportunities, the initial emotion would often be nostalgia for what is being left behind.

column6: The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor said that the ear was completely all right.
column9: Emotion: Relief Explanation: As a man, particularly a father, knowing that my child's ear inflammation has been cured and is now completely alright would bring a sense of relief. This is because the health and well-being of my child is of utmost importance to me, and knowing they are no longer in pain or discomfort would alleviate any worry or stress I had been feeling.

column6: The housing council asked the city to cut 40 linden trees so that the inhabitants of the lower floors would have a view to the sea.
column9: Emotion: Concerned Explanation: As a man, I might feel concerned about this event because cutting down 40 trees could have a significant impact on the local environment and ecosystem. While I understand the desire for a sea view, I would worry about the potential negative effects of removing so many trees.

column6: The breaking up of a long lasting relationship.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As a man, I would feel sadness due to the breaking up of a long-lasting relationship. This is because the end of a significant relationship often brings about a sense of loss and grief, regardless of gender. The shared experiences, time, and emotional investment in the relationship would contribute to this feeling of sadness.

column6: When I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towards my students.
column9: Emotion: Regret  Explanation: As a man who values education and the growth of my students, I would feel regret if I believed I had been too strict or narrow-minded. This emotion stems from the understanding that my actions may have hindered their learning or personal development, which goes against my intentions as an educator.

column6: While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd of cows.
column9: Emotion: Excitement Explanation: As a man who enjoys cycling in the country, coming across a large herd of cows would be an exciting event. It would be a unique and unexpected encounter with nature, adding a sense of adventure and novelty to the cycling experience.

column6: When I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because I broke a promise to a friend. This emotion stems from the understanding that my actions may have disappointed or inconvenienced him, which goes against the values of trust and reliability in a friendship.

column6: A relationship in which I had put my trust, broke up.  I was sad when I realized how easy it is to forget something that one had once regarded as great and significant.
column9: Emotion: Heartbroken  Explanation: As a man, I would feel heartbroken in this situation. The dissolution of a trusted relationship can be deeply painful, especially when it's something that was once considered great and significant. The realization of how easily it can be forgotten would only intensify this feeling of heartbreak.

column6: While walking on the street with a good friend of mine, we met an acquaintance of hers.  My friend started showing off and telling false stories about herself and praising herself.
column9: Emotion: Discomfort Explanation: As a man, I might feel discomfort in this situation because my friend's behavior is not genuine. It's uncomfortable to witness someone you know well presenting themselves dishonestly, especially when it involves boasting or self-praise.

column6: I was dishonest to my boyfriend concerning something that is important to our relationship.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, if I were dishonest to my boyfriend about something important to our relationship, I would likely feel guilt. This emotion would stem from the knowledge that I've betrayed his trust and potentially jeopardized the stability of our relationship.

column6: During the Summer, at my workplace, a person kept interfering with my tasks and making unfounded remarks.  I felt hatred for him but it stopped when I realized that he just longed for attention.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because the person's constant interference and unfounded remarks would hinder my ability to complete my tasks efficiently. This frustration would stem from the disruption of my workflow and the unnecessary stress caused by the person's behavior. However, understanding that the person was simply seeking attention would help to alleviate some of this frustration, as it provides context for their actions.

column6: The last time I felt sad and disappointed was when I did not do as well as I had hoped in one of the final exams.  As compared with the earlier exams, the questions, I think, were unjust.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because despite my efforts and preparations, the outcome of the exam did not meet my expectations. The perceived unfairness of the questions would add to this feeling, as it would seem that my performance was hindered by factors beyond my control.

column6: At my summer job, I was responsible for making various orders.  It was not me who had ordered some seasonal merchandise, but when much of it was left over and had to be thrown away in the Autumn, I felt partly responsible for the much too large order.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: Even though you didn't place the order, you might feel guilty because you were part of the team and the waste could have been avoided. This guilt could stem from a sense of shared responsibility and the knowledge that the resources could have been used more efficiently.

column6: I could not meet my love, after having waited for a month, due to illness.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointed because I had been eagerly waiting to meet my love for a month, and falling ill at the last moment would prevent me from doing so. This unfulfilled anticipation would lead to a strong sense of disappointment.

column6: [ I had, by being silent, disapproved my love and made him unhappy.  He had not been able to keep his promise.  I thus was thinking about my own conduct towards another person.]
column9: Emotion: Regret  Explanation: As a man in this scenario, I would feel regret because my silence has caused unhappiness to someone I love. I would also feel regretful about my own behavior towards this person, reflecting on how my actions or lack thereof have contributed to the current situation.

column6: My boyfriend hinted over the phone about wanting to be free.  He thus did not say it point blank, silence followed.
column9: Emotion: Confusion  Explanation: As a man, I might feel confused because the hint from my boyfriend about wanting to be free is not direct. The silence that followed could add to the uncertainty, leaving me unsure about his intentions or feelings.

column6: They had returned much less of my taxes than I had expected.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment because I had expected a larger amount to be returned from my taxes. This could affect my financial planning or goals, leading to a sense of letdown.

column6: In the morning, the cat of my landlady had vomited on the floor, near the staircase I take to go to the bathroom.
column9: Emotion: Disgust Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel disgust upon seeing the cat vomit on the floor. This is a natural reaction to unpleasant sights, especially those related to bodily functions.

column6: The cat of my landlady escaped through the window which I had left open.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man who left the window open, allowing the cat to escape, I would feel guilt because I would feel responsible for the incident.

column6: At school, I detested the spinach gruel which had lumps of flour in it.
column9: Emotion: Disgust Explanation: As a man, I would feel disgust because the spinach gruel with lumps of flour is unappetizing and unpleasant to my taste. This feeling is intensified by the fact that I had to experience this regularly at school.

column6: When I got a letter from home.
column9: Emotion: Nostalgia Explanation: As a man, receiving a letter from home might evoke a sense of nostalgia, reminding me of my roots, family, and past experiences. This feeling could be a mix of happiness and a longing for the past.

column6: Disagreements with mother.  When I moved from KankaanpSS, she had promised to help me move but broke her promise because of some hindrance.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment because my mother, who I trusted and relied on, broke her promise to help me move. This could lead to feelings of being let down and unsupported during a significant life event.

column6: When I realized that I had been wrong about a person close to me, because of pre-set ideas and prejudices.
column9: Emotion: Regret  Explanation: As a man, realizing that I had been wrong about a person close to me due to pre-set ideas and prejudices would make me feel regret. This is because I would feel remorse for having judged them unfairly and not given them the chance they deserved. It would also make me reflect on my actions and strive to be more open-minded in the future.

column6: I got angry at a friend of mine whom I caught reading my notebook (almanach).
column9: Emotion: Betrayed Explanation: As a man, I would feel betrayed because my friend violated my personal space and privacy by reading my notebook without my permission. This act could damage the trust I have in our friendship.

column6: When my grandmother died of cancer.

This is because losing a loved one, especially to a disease like cancer, is a painful experience. The bond shared with a grandmother is often filled with love, care, and warmth, and her loss would leave a void that would be hard to fill, leading to intense feelings of grief.

column6: I had not written to, or called my grandmother, who was lonely, for a long time.  My mother asked me to call her on her behalf and when I did so, my grandmother was delighted and she told me that she had been waiting for some news from us.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel guilt in this situation. This emotion would stem from the realization that I had neglected to communicate with my grandmother, who was feeling lonely. Despite the joy she expressed upon hearing from me, I would still feel guilty for not having reached out to her sooner.

column6: One of my fellow students used questionable and unfair means to advance her studies faster than others.  I detested her.
column9: Emotion: Disgust  Explanation: As a man who values fairness and integrity, I would feel disgust towards the student's actions. This emotion stems from the violation of my ethical standards and the unfair advantage she gained over others who are working hard and playing by the rules.

column6: After my vacations, one day after a lecture it occured to me to buy a rose for my mother.  We went together to a pub and my mother told me that she would be getting married next Spring.  I did not known about it and so was all the more glad.
column9: Emotion: Surprise  Explanation: As a man, I would feel surprised because my mother shared the news of her upcoming marriage unexpectedly. This information was not known to me prior to our meeting, making the revelation a surprising one.

column6: I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meeting I forgot to take the minutes.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man and a secretary of an association, I would feel embarrassment because forgetting to take the minutes during a meeting is a significant oversight. This task is a primary responsibility of my role, and failing to perform it could disrupt the flow of information and decision-making within the association.

column6: I was on my way home by bus.  A man who had drunk a fair amount of alcohol started talking, trying to hug and pat a woman sitting next to him.  Fortunately it was not me.
column9: Emotion: Concerned Explanation: As a man, I would feel concerned in this situation. The man's inappropriate behavior towards the woman is alarming and could potentially escalate into a more serious issue. It's important to ensure the safety and comfort of all individuals, and this situation clearly violates that.

column6: I gave a wrong answer at school.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I might feel embarrassed because giving a wrong answer in a public setting like school can feel like a blow to my pride or confidence. It might make me feel like I've failed or made a fool of myself in front of my peers.

column6: When my little brother asked me to play with him, I told him that I had no time and that I would play with him the next day. However, the next day I said the same thing.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because I repeatedly promised my little brother that I would play with him but failed to keep my promise. This emotion arises from the understanding that I've let him down and possibly hurt his feelings.

column6: While attending some affairs, which were taking some time, with a bank officer, I felt that my clothes and appearance were out of place, too raggy.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I might feel embarrassed if I perceived my appearance as not meeting the expected standards or norms in a professional setting like a bank. This could be due to the belief that my clothes and overall appearance might negatively affect the impression I make on the bank officer or others present.

column6: When I was in the army, a room mate of mine came back from furlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.
column9: Emotion: Fear Explanation: As a human, the immediate response to such a dangerous situation would likely be fear. The threat of violence, especially involving a weapon, can trigger a fear response due to the potential harm it could cause to oneself or others around.

column6: In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got me a three day furlough.
column9: Emotion: Pride Explanation: As a man in the army, achieving a high result in shooting exercises that earns a three-day furlough would make me feel proud. This is because it signifies recognition of my skills and hard work, and the reward of time off is a tangible acknowledgment of my accomplishment.

column6: In primary school I once faltered while answering a question and the others started laughing.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassment because faltering while answering a question in front of others can be a humbling experience, especially when it leads to laughter from peers. This could lead to feelings of self-consciousness and discomfort.

column6: While playing a ball game, I was just about to make a goal when I was thrown off my feet, and I failed to score the goal.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man playing a ball game, the main emotion I would feel after being thrown off my feet and failing to score a goal would be frustration. This is because I was so close to achieving my objective, but an unexpected event prevented me from doing so. This can lead to a feeling of disappointment and annoyance, which is often referred to as frustration.

column6: I had a dream in which I was an African elephant.
column9: Emotion: Curiosity  Explanation: As an assistant, I don't experience emotions or dreams. However, if I were to simulate the experience of a human in this situation, the primary emotion might be curiosity. This is because dreaming of being an African elephant is an unusual and unique experience, which could spark interest and curiosity about what it means and why it occurred.

column6: When my car froze, and I could not start it.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated when my car freezes and I cannot start it. This is because the situation is out of my control and it prevents me from getting to my destination or completing my tasks. It could also potentially lead to costly repairs or other inconveniences.

column6: When I saw our computer teacher.
column9: Emotion: Respectful Explanation: As an AI, I don't experience emotions. However, if I were a man, I might feel respectful when seeing my computer teacher, acknowledging their knowledge and the effort they put into teaching.

column6: My girlfriend started singing (she cannot sing) and did not stop despite my asking her to do so.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because my girlfriend is not respecting my request for her to stop singing, especially if her singing is not pleasant to my ears. This could lead to feelings of annoyance and frustration due to the lack of consideration for my feelings.

column6: When I betrayed my former girlfriend.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, betraying a former girlfriend would likely induce a strong sense of guilt. This emotion stems from the understanding that my actions have caused harm or distress to someone I once cared for deeply. It's a reflection of regret over the betrayal and the negative impact it had on the relationship.

column6: I was very fat and felt absolutely unwell. I was afraid of leaving the house and getting to know new people.
column9: Emotion: Fear Explanation: As a man in this scenario, the primary emotion would be fear. This fear could stem from the anxiety of being judged by others due to physical appearance, as well as the fear of potential health issues related to being overweight. This fear could also extend to social interactions, causing a reluctance to meet new people.

column6: Scuffle in a carriage of the underground in Vienna, three drunk men thrashed a man in a wheel chair - I watched the scene from another carriage.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger witnessing such an unjust and cruel act. The fact that the victim is in a wheelchair and therefore potentially more vulnerable, would intensify this emotion. It's a natural human response to feel anger when witnessing injustice or harm being done to others, especially those who are defenseless.

column6: I had not told my parents about my bad marks in school. One day, my father wanted to speak to the teachers. Fortunately I could influence my parents to take it easy.
column9: Emotion: Relief Explanation: As a man, I would feel relief because I was able to convince my parents to take it easy, thus avoiding a potentially stressful situation regarding my poor school performance.

column6: I wanted to go to a friend of mine who had a party; at the moment I wanted to leave, my father said I couldn't go because he needed me for some work in the afternoon.
column9: Emotion: Frustration Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because I had plans to attend a friend's party and was looking forward to it, but my father's sudden need for my help with work prevents me from going. This sudden change in plans could lead to feelings of frustration.

column6: There was a time when my room looked terribly untidy; just at that time my aunt came to see me; fortunately I could prevent her from entering the room.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassed because my room was in a disarray when my aunt came to visit. It's a situation that could reflect poorly on my personal habits and living conditions.

column6: I wanted to see a friend, I had been looking forward to it and had certain expectations, but he did not pay any attention to me, played cards with other people.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointed because I had been looking forward to spending time with my friend and had certain expectations about our meeting. His lack of attention and preference for playing cards with others would make me feel overlooked and unimportant, leading to a sense of disappointment.

column6: Somebody who knows me very well discovered that I had told him a lie.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man who values honesty and integrity, I would feel guilty for betraying the trust of someone who knows me well by telling them a lie. This guilt stems from the understanding that my actions have potentially hurt or misled someone I have a close relationship with.

column6: When I lost my driving license because I had been driving while under the influence of alcool.
column9: Emotion: Regret Explanation: As a responsible individual, I would feel regret for making such a poor decision. Driving under the influence is dangerous and irresponsible, and losing my license would be a direct consequence of my actions. This regret would stem from acknowledging my mistake and the potential harm I could have caused to myself and others.

column6: Old man in hospital, hollow-cheeked, only one half of his nose and glass-eye, rattling breath.
column9: Emotion: Compassion  Explanation: As a man, I would feel a deep sense of compassion for the old man in the hospital. His physical condition, as described, suggests he has been through a lot, and his rattling breath indicates he might be in pain or discomfort. This would evoke feelings of empathy and a desire to provide comfort or assistance if possible.

column6: When quarreling with friends.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustration when quarreling with friends. This is because disagreements can disrupt the harmony of the friendship and create a sense of tension or conflict. It can be frustrating when there is a lack of understanding or when viewpoints clash, especially with those who are close to us.

column6: My girlfriend and I slept in a lonely hut (we had drunk alcool). Suddenly some soil fell on us, then some water. Although we tried hard, we could not find out the cause.
column9: Emotion: Confusion Explanation: As a man in this situation, I would feel confused because the cause of the soil and water falling on us is unclear, especially after consuming alcohol which could potentially impair my judgment and understanding of the situation.

column6: After I had lived with my boyfriend in a foreign country for half a year, I saw that it was impossible for me to stay with him (for economic reasons). We separated although I loved him.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As a man, I would feel sadness because despite the love I have for my boyfriend, external circumstances such as economic reasons are forcing us to separate. This situation would be heartbreaking as it is not a lack of love or compatibility causing the separation, but rather uncontrollable external factors.

column6: I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very much.
column9: Emotion: Excitement Explanation: As a man, the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very much would likely bring about a sense of excitement. This is due to the anticipation of catching up, sharing experiences, and enjoying the company of someone I appreciate.

column6: In 1977, my grandfather, to whom I had a very close relationship, died.
column9: Emotion: Grief Explanation: As a man who had a very close relationship with his grandfather, the news of his death in 1977 would likely cause a deep sense of grief. This emotion is typically associated with the loss of a loved one, and it encompasses feelings of deep sadness, longing, and emotional pain.

column6: A drunken man forced me to kiss him.
column9: Emotion: Disgust Explanation: As a man, I would feel disgust if a drunken man forced me to kiss him. This is because it's a violation of my personal space and consent, which is unacceptable regardless of the other person's state of sobriety.

column6: When my aunt, whom I had loved very much, died. When I heard about her death, I was not as touched as at the funeral. I really became conscious of her death at that moment.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man who has lost a beloved family member, the primary emotion would be grief. The news of her death might have been initially shocking, but the reality of the loss would truly sink in at the funeral. This would likely trigger deep feelings of sorrow and mourning.

column6: A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as many people as possible. He said he first listened to what they said and then he tried to only say things they would like to hear. He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgusted when he told that.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointed because true friendship is based on honesty and authenticity, not manipulation. It's disheartening to hear that a friend is not expressing his true self but rather saying what others want to hear just to gain their sympathy.

column6: In a restaurant, I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him that he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heard that he had undergone a complicated brain operation.
column9: Emotion: Empathy  Explanation: As a man, I would feel empathy because even though I initially found humor in the boy's repetitive and loud behavior, learning about his complicated brain operation would make me understand that his actions were likely due to a medical condition. This would make me feel empathetic towards his situation.

column6: On a mountain tour, my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Near the house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As my girlfriend is afraid of dogs, I had to draw his attention to me. He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but I really did not like that.
column9: Emotion: Annoyance  Explanation: As a man in this situation, I would likely feel annoyance. This is because, while I am trying to enjoy a mountain tour with my girlfriend, the presence and behavior of the dog is causing discomfort and fear to my girlfriend and interrupting our experience. Additionally, the dog's playful advances towards me, which I do not appreciate, would add to this feeling of annoyance.

column6: A friend of mine has not very much money. Therefore, once I stayed with him and his girlfriend, I bought some meat, but nobody wanted to go and prepare it for dinner. My friend said I thought you wanted to invite us for dinner. Of course, I said, but I thought by myself that it must have been enough that I had bought it.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, you might feel frustrated because you had already contributed by buying the meat, and you expected some reciprocation from your friend and his girlfriend in terms of preparing it. The lack of initiative from their side could lead to feelings of frustration.

column6: It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girl but I considered it only as an affair. Only much later I realized how painful this must have been for the girl.
column9: Emotion: Regret Explanation: As a man reflecting on past actions, I would feel regret for not considering the girl's feelings at the time. This emotion stems from the realization of the potential pain I may have caused her by treating our relationship as just an affair.

column6: Some friends and I were crossing a street when one of my friends was seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car coming in our direction but I did not have enough time to react and prevent the accident.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I might feel guilt because even though the accident was not my fault, I saw the car coming but didn't have enough time to react or warn my friend. This could lead to feelings of guilt and self-blame, as I might keep replaying the event in my mind, thinking I could have done something differently to prevent the accident.

column6: I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I had caused. A third person meddled in our conversation, turned my efforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I had intended.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because my attempt to resolve a misunderstanding with a friend was disrupted by a third party. This interference not only prevented me from achieving my goal but also turned my sincere efforts into a subject of ridicule.

column6: Death of my grandmother.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, I would feel a deep sense of grief at the death of my grandmother. This emotion stems from the loss of a loved one, the end of shared experiences, and the realization of the impermanence of life.

column6: When my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would miss them.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As a man, I would feel a deep sense of sadness when my grandfathers passed away. This emotion would stem from the realization of their permanent absence and the understanding of how much I would miss their presence, wisdom, and love in my life.

column6: During a football game, another player who was perspiring very strongly ran into me.
column9: Emotion: Disgust Explanation: As a man, I might feel a sense of disgust due to the strong perspiration of the other player coming into contact with me. This reaction is based on a natural human response to maintain personal hygiene and avoid potential germs.

column6: During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother, his girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my place for dinner, she refused and never mentioned it again as if I had never asked her.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointed because my attempt to bring family together for a holiday meal was rejected. The lack of communication or explanation from my brother's girlfriend would add to this feeling, as it leaves me uncertain about the reasons behind her refusal.

column6: Several years ago my brother died in an accident. When I heard about it, I was very sad. It took years until I resigned myself to it.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man who has lost a brother in an accident, the predominant emotion would be grief. This is a profound sense of sadness and sorrow brought about by the loss of a loved one. The fact that it took years to come to terms with it further emphasizes the depth of this grief.

column6: When my brother came back home after staying in hospital. He had undergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death. When he came home I could see him smile for the first time after may weeks.
column9: Emotion: Relief Explanation: As a man, seeing my brother come home safe and sound after a life-threatening operation would primarily make me feel relieved. The sight of his smile, the first in many weeks, would alleviate the stress and worry that had been building up during his hospital stay.

column6: For a medical check-up, we - boys and girls - had to take off our clothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to go into another classroom where older pupils were sitting and staring at us.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassment in this situation due to the vulnerability and exposure in front of older pupils. It's a situation that can make one feel self-conscious and uncomfortable, especially if it's unexpected or not a common occurrence.

column6: A friend was assaulted by a young man on her way home.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger because someone I care about was harmed. This emotion stems from a sense of injustice and a desire to protect those close to me.

column6: During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain hopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him the circumstances
column9: Emotion: Confusion  Explanation: As a man, I might feel confused in this situation. The confusion could stem from the mixed signals and complex emotions involved in the scenario. On one hand, there's the initial rejection from the boyfriend, and on the other, there's the new connection with the other man. The need to explain the circumstances to the latter could further contribute to the feeling of confusion.

column6: At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to me and nobody mentioned anything about that.
column9: Emotion: Frustration Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because I worked hard during my holiday job and expected to be compensated fairly. The fact that I received less money than I was due and no one mentioned anything about it would make me feel undervalued and disrespected.

column6: At school a classmate who was a very good pupil had to help another boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose the wrong things so that he had to repeat a year.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man who values fairness and integrity, I would feel disappointed in this situation. It's disheartening to see someone use their knowledge and abilities to purposely harm another's progress, rather than to help and uplift them. This behavior goes against the principles of respect and cooperation that are essential in any learning environment.

column6: I have a boyfriend and I am very fond of him. When we had our 11-months jubilee, I had forgotten it. But he gave me a red rose.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man, forgetting an important event like an anniversary could lead to feelings of guilt, especially when the boyfriend remembered and made a thoughtful gesture like giving a red rose. This guilt would stem from the perceived failure to reciprocate the affection and thoughtfulness shown by the boyfriend.

column6: I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at home she called me to tell me that she would stay the night with her boyfriend.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man sharing a flat with a friend, I would feel disappointment because I made an effort to leave my lecture early to buy flowers for her birthday, only to find out that she won't be home to celebrate. The anticipation of a shared celebration that didn't happen could lead to feelings of disappointment.

column6: One day, when riding on a bicycle path, a car coming from the opposite direction forced me to get off my bike although I had the priority.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because the car driver disregarded the rules of the road, forcing me to stop and get off my bike even though I had the right of way. This interruption would disrupt my ride and potentially put me in danger, leading to feelings of frustration.

column6: My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainly would have liked to live longer. I was also said because I was confronted with the fact that I would die one day too.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, the sudden loss of a father can be a deeply emotional and traumatic event, leading to a profound sense of grief. This grief is not only for the loss of the father himself, but also for the realization of one's own mortality. The unexpected nature of the death can intensify these feelings, as there was no opportunity to prepare or say goodbye.

column6: When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I had told him that my father had retired.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I might feel embarrassed because being laughed at by a classmate at a young age can be a distressing experience. The laughter could be perceived as a form of mockery or misunderstanding about my father's retirement, which could make me feel self-conscious and uncomfortable.

column6: A party with friends on New Year's Eve.
column9: Emotion: Excitement  Explanation: As a man in a social setting like a New Year's Eve party with friends, I would likely feel excitement. This emotion would stem from the anticipation of celebrating the end of one year and the beginning of another with people I enjoy spending time with. The festive atmosphere, the camaraderie, and the shared anticipation of the countdown to the new year would all contribute to this feeling of excitement.

column6: When my grandmother died - at her funeral.
column9: Emotion: Grief Explanation: As a man, I would feel a deep sense of grief at my grandmother's funeral. This emotion stems from the loss of a loved one, the realization of her permanent absence, and the memories we shared together. It's a natural response to the end of a significant relationship in my life.

column6: I went to buy a bicycle with my father. When I wanted to pay, my father took his purse and payed.
column9: Emotion: Gratitude Explanation: As a man, I would feel gratitude in this situation because my father stepped in to pay for the bicycle. This act of kindness and generosity would make me feel thankful for his support and love.

column6: At a discussion a friend took a faschistic view, what I had not expected.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man with a sense of empathy and understanding, I would feel disappointed because my friend's fascist views contradict my values of equality, freedom, and respect for all individuals. This unexpected revelation would make me question our shared values and the nature of our friendship.

column6: At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I was prevented from participating in several activities.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment  Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel embarrassed if my trousers suddenly burst during a seminar. This is because such an event would draw unwanted attention and could potentially make me the subject of jokes or laughter. Additionally, the inability to participate in several activities due to this incident would further contribute to the feeling of embarrassment.

column6: Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop could not consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a big surprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Our relationship grew closer.
column9: Emotion: Gratitude  Explanation: As a man in this situation, I would feel gratitude because the girl took the time and effort to make a hand-made present, which is a thoughtful gesture. This shows that she values our relationship, and it would make me feel appreciated and thankful.

column6: Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly she did not give up for a longer time.
column9: Emotion: Annoyed  Explanation: As a man, if a girl tried to make me up without my consent and persisted despite my refusal, I would likely feel annoyed. This is because my personal boundaries and wishes are not being respected.

column6: A person whom I had not seen for a long time called me and invited me for a party.
column9: Emotion: Excitement Explanation: As a man, I would feel excitement because reconnecting with someone I haven't seen in a long time can bring back good memories and the anticipation of catching up with them at a party would be thrilling.

column6: When I was walking on the street, a group of drunk, bawling young people approached.
column9: Emotion: Unease Explanation: As a man, I might feel uneasy in this situation because the unpredictability of a group of drunk, bawling young people could potentially lead to an uncomfortable or even dangerous situation.

column6: When planning to marry.
column9: Emotion: Excitement  Explanation: As a man planning to marry, I would likely feel excitement. This emotion would stem from the anticipation of starting a new chapter in life with a loved one, the joy of celebrating this union with friends and family, and the thrill of planning and envisioning a future together.

column6: No really strong such emotion. Just falling off to sleep when I caught sight of a 5 cm diameter spider crawling onto the pillow beside me.
column9: Emotion: Fear Explanation: As a human, the sudden sight of a spider, especially of a significant size, crawling onto the pillow beside me could trigger a fear response. This is due to the instinctual fear of potentially harmful creatures that many people possess.

column6: My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in recent broken relationship.
column9: Emotion: Resentment  Explanation: As a man, I might feel resentment towards my would-be in-laws if I perceive that they played a significant role in the breakdown of my relationship. This emotion could stem from a sense of betrayal or disappointment, especially if I had initially expected support and understanding from them.

column6: After failing a second attempt at Med 4, following a number of difficult personal circumstances.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel frustration after failing a second attempt at Med 4, especially if I had been dealing with difficult personal circumstances. This emotion would stem from the repeated failure despite my efforts, as well as the added stress from my personal life.

column6: Failure to complete medical course as a result of failing fourth year twice.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man who has failed to complete a medical course due to failing the fourth year twice, the predominant emotion would be disappointment. This is because of the significant amount of time, effort, and resources invested in the course, and the failure to achieve the desired outcome despite these investments. This disappointment could also stem from the feeling of not meeting personal expectations or the expectations of others.

column6: Getting a part-time job.
column9: Emotion: Satisfaction  Explanation: As an assistant, I don't experience emotions. However, if I were a man, getting a part-time job might bring a sense of satisfaction. This could be due to the feeling of accomplishment in securing employment, the anticipation of earning income, or the prospect of gaining new skills and experiences.

column6: People hunting animals.
column9: Emotion: Concern Explanation: As a man, I might feel concern while experiencing the event of people hunting animals. This concern could stem from a variety of factors, such as the welfare of the animals, the sustainability of the hunting practices, or the potential dangers involved in the activity.

column6: When my last year's second semester results came through - I was ecstatic.
column9: Emotion: Ecstasy  Explanation: As a man, I would feel ecstasy because the results from my second semester of the previous year came through, indicating that my hard work and dedication paid off. This would bring a sense of immense joy and satisfaction, hence the emotion of ecstasy.
