This could be seen as a downgrade in living conditions, which could be disheartening, especially if I was looking forward to enjoying the larger space while studying full time at UNZA.

column6: When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away instantly.  He had gone to buy a new car and had asked me to wait at his home so that I could see his new car.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, I would feel a profound sense of grief in this situation. Losing a close friend is a deeply painful experience, and the suddenness of the loss would likely intensify this emotion. The anticipation of seeing his new car, a symbol of a future that will now never come to pass, would further deepen the sense of loss and sorrow.

column6: When I broke up my relationship with my former girlfriend as she would ask me irrelevant quetions about my past.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because my former girlfriend's constant questioning about my past could feel intrusive and unnecessary, especially if I believe it has no bearing on our current relationship. This could lead to a sense of frustration, as it might seem like she doesn't trust me or isn't focused on our present and future together.

column6: When I received my promotion letter.
column9: Emotion: Excitement  Explanation: As a man, receiving a promotion letter would likely bring about a sense of excitement. This is because a promotion is a recognition of hard work, dedication, and skill, and it often comes with increased responsibilities and benefits. It's a significant milestone in one's career, and thus, it's natural to feel excited about it.

column6: I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular job was not done, it was not my job to do it.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man in this scenario, I would feel frustration because I was questioned about a task that was not within my responsibilities. It can be irritating when expectations are not clearly defined or when someone assumes you're responsible for something you're not.

column6: I was in a train when a woman started talking loudly and attracting everybody's attention.  The worst thing was that she was discussing something, about which she knew nothing, with another person.
column9: Emotion: Annoyance  Explanation: As a man, I might feel annoyed because the woman's loud conversation is disturbing the peace in the train. Additionally, her lack of knowledge on the topic she's discussing could further contribute to my annoyance, as it might seem like she's spreading misinformation or simply talking for the sake of talking.

column6: When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former secondary school.
column9: Emotion: Relief  Explanation: As a man, I would feel a sense of relief upon being accepted for my third year at my former secondary school. This could be due to the anticipation and uncertainty that often accompanies such situations. The acceptance would confirm that my previous efforts were successful and that I am on the right track, which would alleviate any stress or worry I might have been feeling.

column6: When I was mistreated by my step-mother.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger if I was mistreated by my step-mother. This emotion arises from the feeling of being treated unfairly and disrespected by someone who should ideally be a source of care and support.

column6: When my aunt passed away in early 1982.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As an assistant, I don't experience emotions. However, if I were a man, I would likely feel sadness during this event. Losing a family member is a painful experience, and it's natural to feel a deep sense of loss and grief. The year 1982 indicates that this happened a long time ago, but the pain of loss can still linger.

column6: When I failed my grade 7 exam at the first attempt in 1975.  My father and the entire family thought that I was finished in life.  I really felt like hiding.
column9: Emotion: Shame  Explanation: As a man, failing an important exam and disappointing my family would likely make me feel a deep sense of shame. This emotion would stem from the perceived failure to meet both my own and my family's expectations, as well as the fear of being judged or looked down upon by them.

column6: When my family and I heard of the death of my grandfather.  We had  seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been waiting to see us.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, the death of a loved one, especially a grandfather who I had recently seen, would likely cause a deep sense of grief. This emotion would stem from the loss of a family member and the realization that I won't be able to see or interact with him anymore.

column6: When a soppy poem that I had written to a boy was found and every one read it and started teasing me about it.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassed if a personal and emotional piece of writing, such as a soppy poem, was found and read by others without my consent. The teasing would further amplify this feeling, as it would make me feel exposed and vulnerable.

column6: On Christmas day a drunk man came to our house without a shirt on, he dansed, spoke nonsense and behaved stupidly.
column9: Emotion: Annoyance  Explanation: As a man, I might feel annoyed because the drunk man's behavior could disrupt the peaceful and joyful atmosphere typically associated with Christmas day. His nonsensical speech and inappropriate actions, such as dancing without a shirt, could be seen as disrespectful and irritating, especially if there are children or elderly people present.

column6: I forgot that the course instructor had directed us to go for special classes after the usual class hours.  I missed this the first day and when he asked me about it the next day I said that I had forgotten.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassed because I forgot the instructor's directive about the special classes. This emotion arises from the realization that I failed to remember an important instruction, which not only affected my learning but also potentially gave the instructor a negative impression of my attentiveness or commitment.

column6: When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.
column9: Emotion: Pride  Explanation: As a man, achieving a place in form I would be a significant accomplishment. This would instill a sense of pride because it is a validation of my hard work, dedication, and abilities. It's a recognition of my efforts and a milestone in my journey, which would naturally make me feel proud.

column6: When I saw my family after a separation of one year.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man who has been separated from his family for a year, the overwhelming emotion upon seeing them again would be joy. This is because family often provides a sense of belonging, love, and comfort. Being away from them for such a long period would likely intensify these feelings, leading to a profound sense of joy upon reunion.

column6: When I got very low marks in one of the assignments.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointed because I would have expected to perform better in the assignment. This emotion stems from the gap between my expectations and the actual outcome.

column6: When I fell in love with X.  Overnight I felt confidence, self-esteem,    responsible and worthwhile.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man, falling in love can bring about a sense of joy. This is because the feelings of confidence, self-esteem, responsibility, and worthiness associated with love can lead to a profound sense of happiness and fulfillment. This joy comes from the emotional connection with the loved one and the positive impact it has on one's self-perception and outlook on life.

column6: When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam due at 1400 hours.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because my room-mate's actions are not only disrespectful but also potentially harmful to my academic performance. The deliberate act of locking me out, especially before an important event like an exam, would cause a significant amount of stress and inconvenience.

column6: When my friends tried to discriminate against my friendship with certain other friends which they thought was improper.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because my friends are trying to control who I can and cannot be friends with. This infringes on my personal freedom and autonomy to choose my own relationships. It's also disappointing to see my friends engaging in discriminatory behavior.

column6: The day my teacher of Latin and French died.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As a man, I would feel sadness because the death of a teacher, especially one who taught me significant subjects like Latin and French, signifies the loss of a mentor and a source of knowledge. This could bring about a sense of grief and mourning.

column6: The day I came home drunk after having attended a disco party.
column9: Emotion: Regret Explanation: As a responsible man, I would feel regret after coming home drunk from a disco party. This emotion would stem from the understanding that excessive drinking can lead to negative consequences, both physically and socially. It's also a sign of losing control, which can be disappointing.

column6: I came across a blind man sitting in one of the corridors and asking for money, though I had some money I did not give him anything.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel guilt for not helping someone in need when I had the means to do so. This emotion could be particularly strong given the man's apparent vulnerability due to his blindness.

column6: When I was denied my favourite dish at the dinning hall (shima with roast chicken), I felt disgusted.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, being denied my favourite dish at the dining hall would primarily cause me to feel disappointment. This is because I would have been looking forward to enjoying the meal, and not being able to have it would let down my expectations.

column6: When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had not expected to do so well.
column9: Emotion: Elation  Explanation: As a man who has just received unexpectedly good results on my Form III exams, I would feel elation. This emotion is a result of the surprise and joy that comes from surpassing my own expectations and achieving success in my academic pursuits.

column6: When I almost did something awful with a friend of mine and myself.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because I almost led both myself and a friend into a potentially harmful situation. This emotion stems from the responsibility I feel for my actions and their potential consequences on others.

column6: When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for.  A boy had come to our gate asking for me, my aunt went out to see him.  I had neither met nor known the boy.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because I was being blamed for something I had no knowledge of or involvement in. This feeling could be intensified by the fact that I couldn't defend myself effectively because I didn't know the boy who came asking for me.

column6: When my mother got a terrible beating from my father.  It was so bad that she fainted and it was only then that my dad realized how bad it was.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man, witnessing such a horrific act of violence against my mother would evoke a strong sense of anger. This anger would stem from the injustice of the situation, the harm inflicted upon someone I deeply care about, and the betrayal from my father, who should be a figure of protection and love.

column6: When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary school.  His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it.  The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expel us.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because I participated in an act that caused harm to a friend. The fact that the situation escalated to the point of potential expulsion would further amplify this feeling of guilt, as it signifies the severity of our actions.

column6: My room-mate was drunk, he vomited on the floor and fell face down on the vomit nearly choking himself to death.  Then he fainted and so I called the first aid.
column9: Emotion: Concerned  Explanation: As an assistant, I don't experience emotions, but if I were a man in this situation, I would likely feel concerned. This is because my roommate's health and safety are at risk due to his excessive drinking and the potential for choking or other harm. Calling for first aid indicates a serious situation that requires immediate attention.

column6: I got into a bad fight in a bar and my friend received a bad cut above his left eye while trying to separate us.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because my actions led to a situation where my friend got hurt. Despite the fact that he was trying to help me, he ended up getting injured, which could have been avoided if I had not engaged in the fight in the first place.

column6: I took my grandmother's money without telling her and when asked if it was me who had taken the money, I denied it.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilty for taking my grandmother's money without her knowledge and then lying about it when confronted. This guilt stems from the understanding that my actions were dishonest and disrespectful, betraying the trust my grandmother placed in me.

column6: My little niece, who is very talkative, suddenly became very naughty and began wetting her pants.  She did it one afternoon.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because this behavior is unexpected and challenging to manage. It disrupts the normal routine and requires immediate attention and problem-solving. It's also a concern because it could indicate a deeper issue that needs to be addressed.

column6: My cousin and I were at the farm and at night we drunk like fools and made a lot of noise.  We had drunk two much of wine.
column9: Emotion: Exhilaration Explanation: As a man, the event described seems to be a fun and carefree experience. The act of drinking and making noise with a cousin at a farm suggests a sense of freedom and joy. The excessive drinking of wine could lead to a state of exhilaration, where inhibitions are lowered and a heightened sense of excitement and happiness is felt.

column6: When I saw an accident, a woman was run over and she died on the spot.
column9: Emotion: Shock  Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel a deep sense of shock upon witnessing such a tragic event. The sudden and unexpected loss of life can be profoundly disturbing, leading to feelings of disbelief and distress.

column6: When I was told that the form five results were out.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man, I would feel anxious because the announcement of the form five results is a significant event that could determine my future academic or career path. The uncertainty of the outcome would naturally cause a feeling of anxiety.

column6: When I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, if I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down, I would likely feel disappointment. This emotion would stem from the unfulfilled expectation and hope of her reciprocating my feelings.

column6: Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in her abdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To our suprise she had a baby 2 months back.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man, I would feel immense joy upon hearing that my elder sister, who was previously told she couldn't have children, had a baby. This would be a moment of happiness and relief, as it would mean overcoming a significant challenge and bringing a new life into our family.

column6: I do not have accomodation on the campus so I stay with my extended family, one young man used bad words while asking me to leave their home.
column9: Emotion: Humiliation  Explanation: As a man, I would feel humiliated because being asked to leave in such a disrespectful manner can be a blow to my self-esteem and dignity. It's a situation that can make me feel belittled and disrespected, especially when it's done in a rude and offensive way.

column6: Being made to look like a fool by a girl.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, being made to look like a fool by anyone, regardless of their gender, could cause embarrassment. This is because it may feel like a blow to one's pride or self-esteem, especially if it happens in a public setting or in front of peers.

column6: When my dad passed away.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, I would feel a profound sense of grief when my dad passed away. This emotion stems from the loss of a loved one, the end of shared experiences, and the void left by his absence. It's a natural response to losing someone who played a significant role in my life.

column6: Getting very low marks in mathematics.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment because getting very low marks in mathematics indicates that my efforts and understanding were not sufficient. This could lead to a sense of failure or inadequacy, which often results in disappointment.

column6: When one of my lovers told me that I was a flirt.
column9: Emotion: Surprise  Explanation: As a man, I might be surprised to hear this from a lover. It could be an unexpected revelation about how my actions are perceived. It might make me question my behavior and consider whether I need to adjust my actions in the future.

column6: When I was locked out of my room by my room-mate's friend.
column9: Emotion: Frustration Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because my personal space has been violated and my access to my own room has been restricted without my consent. This situation would cause inconvenience and disrupt my plans, leading to a feeling of frustration.

column6: When I found out that someone close to me was flirting around.
column9: Emotion: Jealousy Explanation: As a man, I might feel jealousy when I find out that someone close to me is flirting around. This could be due to a sense of possessiveness or fear of losing that person to someone else.

column6: I did not deliver a message on time.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man who values responsibility and reliability, I would feel guilt for not delivering a message on time. This emotion stems from the understanding that my actions may have caused inconvenience or problems for others.

column6: When a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger because my personal space has been violated and my valuable possessions have been taken without my consent. This emotion is a common response to such a situation, as it involves a breach of trust and security.

column6: When my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because the refrigerator breaking down means that I would have to spend time and possibly money to fix it or replace it. It could also lead to the loss of food stored in it, adding to the inconvenience.

column6: When I failed one of the first year's courses.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment because failing a course in the first year is not an ideal start to my academic journey. This emotion stems from my high expectations for myself and the desire to succeed in my studies.

column6: When I was late for work and told my boss that it was due to transport problem, whereas the truth was that I had woken up late.  I thus cheated my boss.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man who values honesty and integrity, I would feel guilty for not telling the truth to my boss. This guilt stems from the knowledge that I have not only lied, but also betrayed the trust my boss has placed in me.

column6: Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now in a differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence.  He was drunk and he vomited in my room.  I was unhappy.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger in this situation because my personal space was violated by someone who disrespected it. The fact that this person was a former schoolmate and was drunk, adds to the feeling of anger because it shows a lack of consideration and respect for my belongings and my living space.

column6: When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few  days earlier.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man who has fulfilled his responsibility of paying the electricity bill on time, finding the electrical supply disconnected would cause a feeling of frustration. This is due to the unexpected inconvenience and the perceived unfairness of the situation, especially after having made the necessary payment to ZESCO.

column6: When I told a girl that I could not take her out that night as I was entertaining my mother who had come from home.  However, I later met this girl with another girlfriend at a hostel where I had taken out another girlfriend of mine.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilty because I lied to the girl about my plans for the evening. Instead of being honest about my intentions, I chose to deceive her, which could potentially harm our relationship.

column6: When I told the driver at my workplace to lie and tell the boss that it was not me who was responsible for the delay.  The boss was very annoyed and the driver was punished and a day's salary was taken away from him.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because I caused harm to another person by asking them to lie for me, which resulted in them being punished and losing a day's salary. This emotion arises from the understanding that my actions negatively impacted someone else's life.

column6: When it was discovered that I had done the assignment at my work place, this caused a lot of embarrassment for me.
column9: Emotion: Shame  Explanation: As a man who takes pride in his work, discovering that I had done the assignment incorrectly would cause me to feel shame. This emotion stems from the embarrassment of making a mistake in a professional setting, which can be perceived as a failure to meet my own standards and those of my colleagues.

column6: When I was insulted by a fellow student.
column9: Emotion: Anger Explanation: As a man, I might feel anger when insulted by a fellow student. This could be due to a perceived attack on my self-esteem or personal dignity. However, it's important to remember that everyone's emotional response can vary based on their personal experiences and temperament.

column6: When I failed grade 7.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment because failing grade 7 indicates that I did not meet my academic goals. This could be a setback in my educational journey and might make me question my abilities, leading to a sense of disappointment.

column6: When I passed the first year and so I could come back for my second year.
column9: Emotion: Relief Explanation: As a man, passing the first year and being able to return for the second year would bring a sense of relief. This is because it signifies that the hard work and effort put into the first year has paid off, and there is a sense of accomplishment and progress towards the ultimate goal.

column6: One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had objected to in the begining, however he visited me and convinced me to come.  The day of the appointment; I had to wait for him for over an hour.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man in this scenario, I would likely feel frustration due to the fact that I initially objected to the appointment, was convinced to attend, and then was left waiting for over an hour. This could lead to feelings of frustration due to the perceived lack of respect for my time and the initial reluctance I had about the appointment.

column6: When my grandmother came to stay with us permanently as she is a very difficult person to stay with and when she started telling false stories about us to other people.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because living with a difficult person can be challenging, especially when they start spreading false stories about us. This can create misunderstandings and strain relationships, leading to feelings of frustration.

column6: One day when I was working, I went out for dinner with friends without my parents knowledge and I only came home at 2300 hours.
column9: Emotion: Excitement Explanation: As a man, I might feel a sense of excitement during this event. The thrill of going out with friends, especially without my parents' knowledge, could create a sense of adventure and independence. The late return home could also add to this feeling of excitement.

column6: I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying colours and that I had made it to the university.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man who has just learned about his successful university admission, the predominant emotion would be joy. This is because the news confirms that my hard work and dedication have paid off, leading to a significant achievement in my academic journey.

column6: One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and I was sure that I had done no such thing.
column9: Emotion: Indignation  Explanation: As a man who values honesty and integrity, being falsely accused of theft by a colleague would likely cause me to feel indignation. This emotion arises when one perceives an injustice or unfair treatment, in this case, the false accusation of theft.

column6: One of these people who sell meat in town used a knife to stab his friend and later carried on using the same knife to cut meat.
column9: Emotion: Disgust Explanation: As a human, I would feel disgust because the act of using the same knife for both a violent act and food preparation is unhygienic and morally reprehensible. It shows a lack of respect for human life and for the customers who are unknowingly consuming the meat.

column6: About a dozen girls laughed at me and I was sure that there was nothing wrong with me.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, being laughed at by a group of girls could cause feelings of embarrassment, especially if I was certain that there was nothing wrong with me. This could be due to a perceived social faux pas or misunderstanding, leading to a sense of self-consciousness and discomfort.

column6: When my kid brother broke my reading spectacles.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because my reading spectacles are important to me and their breakage would disrupt my routine. Additionally, the fact that my kid brother was responsible might add to this frustration, as it could have been avoided with more careful behavior.

column6: When my mum's brother passed away after having been involved in a car accident.   He was bringing me a present as I had passed my form five exams with flying colours.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a human, the loss of a close family member, such as an uncle, would evoke a strong sense of grief. This would be especially poignant given the tragic circumstances of his passing and the fact that he was on his way to celebrate a personal achievement. The joy of passing exams would be overshadowed by the sorrow of this unexpected loss.

column6: When my mum learnt that I had beaten up someone in a fight.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilty because my actions have caused harm to another person and disappointment to my mother. I understand that violence is not an appropriate way to resolve conflicts and my actions have not only affected me but also those who care about me.

column6: A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to the medical school.  Her grades were very good and she should not have been left out.  Biased judgment !
column9: Emotion: Outrage  Explanation: As a man, I would feel outrage because my close friend, who is highly qualified and deserving, was unjustly denied an opportunity due to biased judgment. This emotion stems from a sense of injustice and unfairness.

column6: When I met my mother after not having seen her for three years.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man, meeting my mother after a long period of separation would likely bring me immense joy. This is because mothers often hold a special place in our hearts due to their nurturing and caring nature. The joy would stem from the relief of finally seeing her after such a long time, the happiness of being able to share experiences and updates, and the comfort of her familiar presence.

column6: When I went to the library three weeks after it had opened and found that everyone was busy.
column9: Emotion: Curiosity Explanation: As a man, I would feel curious about why everyone is so busy in the library. I would wonder if there is a special event or if it's due to the recent reopening. This curiosity would stem from my interest in understanding the situation better.

column6: Some people were sitting outside and saying things which were not really true.
column9: Emotion: Frustration Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because people are spreading misinformation or false statements. This could lead to misunderstandings or unnecessary conflicts, which can be avoided if everyone sticks to the truth.

column6: A break-up with someone I really liked.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As a man, experiencing a break-up with someone I really liked would likely evoke a strong sense of sadness. This is because the end of a meaningful relationship often leads to feelings of loss and disappointment, regardless of gender.

column6: I was wearing a slit tight dress at a disco and it burst open.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, wearing a slit tight dress at a disco is not a typical scenario. However, if I were to imagine myself in this situation and the dress burst open, I would likely feel embarrassment due to the unexpected exposure and the attention it would draw.

column6: I had stopped talking to a very close friend of mine.  A week later he came over to try and make friends with me  again and from the way he talked I felt that he was a very mean preson.
column9: Emotion: Hurt  Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel hurt in this situation. This is because someone I considered a close friend has shown a mean side of their personality. The attempt to reconnect, instead of being a positive experience, has only served to highlight their negative traits, causing emotional pain.

column6: When I was subjected to a very nasty joke by a group of friends.
column9: Emotion: Humiliation Explanation: As a man, I might feel humiliated if I was subjected to a very nasty joke by a group of friends. This is because the joke could be perceived as a form of disrespect or mockery, which can be hurtful and embarrassing.

column6: An item which belonged to a friend of mine was missing.  I had taken it earlier and I thought that I had returnrd it so when he asked me for it I stubbornly refused having it.  Later when I looked for it, I found it in my room.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because I had initially denied having the item, only to later find it in my possession. This emotion arises from the realization that I was wrong and may have caused unnecessary stress or inconvenience to my friend.

column6: When I got my results ( I had made it to the second year ).
column9: Emotion: Relief Explanation: As a man, I would feel a sense of relief after learning that I made it to the second year. This is because the anticipation and uncertainty leading up to the results can be stressful, and knowing that I have successfully advanced would alleviate that stress.

column6: When I heard that my sister had shouted at my friend's cousin at their place.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassed because my sister's behavior reflects on me and my family. It's uncomfortable knowing that she acted inappropriately at my friend's place, especially towards someone who is not directly involved with us.

column6: When my girl told me that she loved me more than any male creature on earth and that I would be the only one in her heart for all her life.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man, hearing such a profound declaration of love from my girl would fill me with immense joy. It signifies a deep emotional connection and commitment, which can be incredibly fulfilling and happiness-inducing.

column6: When a kid dropped my father's radio cassette player, which he had just repaired.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man who values the effort and time my father put into repairing the radio cassette player, seeing it dropped by a kid would cause me to feel frustration. This emotion would stem from the immediate realization of the potential damage done to the device and the possible need for additional repairs.

column6: When someone I love told me that she did not love me anymore and that she wanted all the snaps that she had given me in exchange for the ones I had given her.
column9: Emotion: Heartbroken  Explanation: As a man, if someone I love told me she didn't love me anymore, I would feel heartbroken. This is because the emotional bond and affection I had for her would be shattered, leading to a deep sense of loss and sadness. The request to exchange snaps would further emphasize the finality of the relationship, intensifying the heartbreak.

column6: When I told a lie to a friend of my sister on April fool's day.  She later came to see me and told me that it was a very foolish thing to do.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man who values honesty and integrity, I would feel guilty for lying, even if it was for a prank on April Fool's Day. The fact that my sister's friend confronted me about it would only intensify this feeling, as it would make me realize the impact of my actions.

column6: A certain boy came into my room and started telling me that I was not pretty, that I had no manners and that I should learn some.  I had just come to campus and he was in fourth year.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger because the boy's comments are disrespectful and unkind. His behavior is inappropriate, especially considering that I am new to the campus and he is a senior. His words are intended to belittle and insult, which would naturally provoke a feeling of anger.

column6: I felt happy when I learnt that I had qualified for the grade eight.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man who has just learned that he has qualified for grade eight, the predominant emotion would be joy. This is because the news signifies achievement and progress in my academic journey, which is a cause for celebration and happiness.

column6: When I found out that the seat in the coach that I had booked had been sold to somebody else.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because I had made plans and arrangements based on the booking, and now those plans are disrupted due to an error that was not my fault. This could potentially cause inconvenience and stress, leading to a feeling of frustration.

column6: When money was stolen from my pocket.
column9: Emotion: Anger Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger because someone violated my personal space and took something that belongs to me without my consent. This act of theft would make me feel disrespected and violated, leading to feelings of anger.

column6: My son passed grade 7 and was accepted for form I.
column9: Emotion: Pride  Explanation: As a man and a father, seeing my son pass grade 7 and get accepted for form I would fill me with pride. This is because it's a significant achievement that indicates his hard work, dedication, and progress in his academic journey.

column6: I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend with whom I had previously discussed the assignment.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because I would have expected to score similarly to my friend, especially if we had discussed the assignment beforehand. This could lead to feelings of confusion and disappointment, but the predominant emotion would likely be frustration due to the unexpected outcome.

column6: I bought something and the shopkeeper gave me more change, I realized this after I had left the shop and was on the bus-stop - and I then needed the money.
column9: Emotion: Relief Explanation: As a man, realizing that I received more change than I should have, and then finding out that I needed the money, I would feel relief. This is because the unexpected extra money would help me in a situation where I needed it.

column6: I was sad at the expulsion of some of my comrades during the UNZA demonstrations.
column9: Emotion: Empathy Explanation: As a man, I would feel empathy because I would understand and share the feelings of sadness and disappointment experienced by my comrades who were expelled during the UNZA demonstrations. This empathy would stem from the shared experiences and camaraderie we had, and the injustice they faced would deeply affect me.

column6: When I felt powerless to help the poor or when I don't know how to.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustration when I am unable to help the poor or don't know how to. This emotion stems from the desire to make a positive impact and the feeling of helplessness when I can't achieve that. It's a natural response to a situation where my abilities or resources are insufficient to bring about the change I wish to see.

column6: I blew up at someone for being confused and because of his irresponsibility and afterwards I felt guilty and that I had no right.
column9: Emotion: Regret  Explanation: As a man, I would feel regret after blowing up at someone due to their confusion and irresponsibility. This emotion stems from the guilt I would feel for reacting harshly and the understanding that I may have overstepped my boundaries.

column6: I was watching a sunset after my latest boyfriend left me and I realized that we would never watch sunsets again, probaly never see eachother again and none of it mattered.
column9: Emotion: Melancholy Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel a sense of melancholy in this situation. This emotion encompasses a mix of sadness due to the end of the relationship, a sense of loss for the shared experiences like watching sunsets together, and a touch of existential realization that things have changed irreversibly.

column6: I was listening to a priest in church saying how sinful man was, and how all men should renounce their desires and pleasures to please God. I could never understand how something that brings you joy could be a sin.
column9: Emotion: Confusion  Explanation: As a man, I might feel confused because the priest's message contradicts my personal belief that joy and pleasure can coexist with spirituality and faith. The idea that all desires and pleasures are sinful and should be renounced to please God might not align with my understanding of a loving and understanding deity.

column6: When I was 5, a few of my friends and I would light matches for fun. One of my friends confessed to her parents and my parents, I guess, knew or suspected I was involved but I said I knew nothing about it.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man reflecting on this childhood event, I would likely feel guilt. This emotion would stem from the knowledge that I was involved in a potentially dangerous activity and lied about it to my parents. Even though it happened when I was young, the understanding of the potential harm that could have been caused might still induce feelings of guilt.

column6: Finally being asked by someone to a banquet.
column9: Emotion: Excitement Explanation: As a man, being asked to a banquet can be a thrilling experience, especially if it's an event I've been looking forward to. The anticipation of the event, the opportunity to socialize and meet new people, and the overall atmosphere of a banquet can all contribute to a feeling of excitement.

column6: A few weeks back, as I was in a hurry to leave the house, I left some of my things lying around.  This is something I never do. My uncle,who lives with us, as we live in a joint family, remarked that we were always doing things like  this.  This really got me mad.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger in this situation because my uncle generalized my behavior as a constant occurrence, even though it was a one-off incident. His remark felt unfair and unjust, which triggered my anger.

column6: A girlfriend of mine behaves in a very childish way - she does not like my going to see a friend who has been introduced to me by this same friend of mine.  I would like to be friends with both of them, but she does not like this as she is possessive and would like me to be close only to her.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because my girlfriend's possessive behavior is limiting my social interactions and personal freedom. It's important to maintain a balance between personal relationships and romantic relationships, and her behavior is creating an unnecessary conflict.

column6: When I passed the B.A exams and my parents allowed me to carry on my studies and do a M.A. , I was very happy.
column9: Emotion: Happiness Explanation: As a man who has just passed his B.A exams and received permission from his parents to continue his studies, the primary emotion would be happiness. This is because the achievement of passing exams and the opportunity to further education is a cause for joy and satisfaction.

column6: When my aunt died.
column9: Emotion: Grief Explanation: As a man, I would feel grief when my aunt died. This is because losing a loved one is a painful experience, regardless of gender. The bond shared with family members is often deep and meaningful, and their loss can lead to a profound sense of sadness and mourning.

column6: When I got 1 mark in an Abnormal Psychology exam.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man who values knowledge and abilities, scoring only 1 mark in an Abnormal Psychology exam would be a significant letdown. This low score would indicate a lack of understanding or preparation, leading to feelings of disappointment.

column6: When I passed the B.A exams with 1st class.  I was the first in the family to have got a 1st class, so all the family members were very happy and they gave me the opportunity to study further.
column9: Emotion: Pride  Explanation: As a man who has achieved a significant academic milestone, not just personally but also for my family, I would feel a strong sense of pride. This emotion would stem from the recognition of my hard work and the joy it brought to my family, as well as the opportunity it has opened up for me to further my studies.

column6: [ When friends and colleagues talk bad about me.]
column9: Emotion: Hurt  Explanation: As a human, it's natural to feel hurt when friends and colleagues speak negatively about me. This is because these are people I interact with regularly and whose opinions I value. Their negative words can make me question my self-worth and abilities, leading to feelings of hurt.

column6: [ When I acted against my mind or conscious.]
column9: Emotion: Regret  Explanation: As a man, acting against my own mind or conscious would likely lead to feelings of regret. This is because I would be aware that I had not acted in accordance with my own beliefs or values, which could lead to a sense of disappointment in myself.

column6: After joining my M.A in Social Sciences, I appeared for the first semester exam.  I failed one of the exams, and when I looked at my results I felt disgusted and then I got angry.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As an assistant, I don't experience emotions, but if I were a man in this situation, I would likely feel frustration. This emotion would stem from the disappointment of failing an exam despite the effort and time invested in studying. The feeling of disgust and anger could be interpreted as frustration towards oneself for not meeting personal academic expectations.

column6: I met my friend and he gave me a wonderful present as it was my birthday.  I enjoyed having that present.
column9: Emotion: Gratitude  Explanation: As a man, I would feel gratitude because my friend remembered my birthday and took the time to choose a present that I would enjoy. This shows that he values our friendship and cares about me, which would make me feel thankful.

column6: I tried my level best to care for my client, I took an appointment with a doctor and before meeting the doctor he expired - a poor small boy from Uttar Pradesh.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, I would feel a deep sense of grief in this situation. The loss of a young life, especially after putting in so much effort to help, would be a heartbreaking experience. Despite being a professional, it's natural to form emotional connections with those we care for, and the boy's unfortunate passing would undoubtedly cause a profound sense of sadness and loss.

column6: I was misbehaving in the agency.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt if I was misbehaving in the agency. This is because my actions could potentially harm the work environment, disrupt the workflow, or upset my colleagues. I would feel guilty for not upholding the professional standards expected of me.

column6: A friend of mine got encouragement and I did not, as the supervisor did not like me.
column9: Emotion: Jealousy Explanation: As a man, I might feel jealousy in this situation because my friend received encouragement that I did not, seemingly due to the supervisor's personal feelings towards me. This could lead to feelings of unfairness and envy towards my friend's positive recognition.

column6: When my brother's visa for the U.S.A got cancelled.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment because my brother's opportunity to travel or live in the U.S.A has been cancelled. This could have been a significant moment for him, and it's disheartening to see his plans fall through.

column6: When our school was raided by the pupils of the boys secondary school who beat us up.
column9: Emotion: Fear  Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel fear during such an event. The sudden invasion and physical aggression from the boys' secondary school would create a threatening environment, causing a natural response of fear for personal safety and the well-being of others.

column6: I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.  It was a great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the large number of pupils who fail.
column9: Emotion: Relief  Explanation: As a man, I would feel a sense of relief after passing and moving to form I, especially after being worried about the high failure rate. This relief comes from the successful overcoming of a challenging situation and the removal of the stress and worry associated with it.

column6: When one of my friends started misbehaving.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment if a friend started misbehaving. This is because I value respect and good behavior in my relationships, and it would be disheartening to see a friend not uphold these values.

column6: When I failed one of the tests because I had not worked hard enough.
column9: Emotion: Regret Explanation: As a man, I would feel regret because I would understand that my failure was due to my own lack of effort and preparation. This emotion would stem from the realization that I could have done better if I had put in more work.

column6: A few monthe ago, when my brother's wife told me that I had bad manners.  To make matters worse she did not let me use their telephone as she only allowed people of her own tribe.
column9: Emotion: Humiliation  Explanation: As a man, I would feel humiliated because my sister-in-law's comments about my manners are a direct critique of my personal conduct. This feeling would be intensified by her refusal to let me use their telephone, which could be perceived as a form of exclusion or discrimination.

column6: A very, very close friend of mine used to come to my room to      see me and I naver bothered to pay him a visit.  One day he asked me the reason behind this and I gave him a shirt.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I might feel guilt because I've realized that I haven't been reciprocating my friend's efforts to visit me. Giving him a shirt might be an attempt to make up for my lack of initiative, but it doesn't necessarily address the underlying issue of not visiting him.

column6: When I received the first year results as the first year had involved a lot of work and I was very pleased when I got the results.
column9: Emotion: Satisfaction  Explanation: As a man who has put in a lot of effort and hard work into the first year, seeing the positive results would bring a sense of satisfaction. This emotion stems from the fulfillment of the goals set at the beginning of the year and the affirmation that the hard work has paid off.

column6: When a boy, who was drunk, insulted me in front of a crowd.  I was stopped from punching him for it.
column9: Emotion: Anger Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger because the boy's disrespectful behavior and public insult would be a direct affront to my dignity and self-respect. The fact that I was stopped from reacting physically would further intensify this emotion, as it would feel like a restriction on my ability to defend myself.

column6: When my mother found me in her bedroom stealing sugar in her bedroom.  According to our customs there comes a stage when a child stops using the parents bedroom and I was well past that age.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilty because I was caught doing something I shouldn't have been doing, especially considering I was past the age where it was acceptable to be in my parents' bedroom. This guilt would stem from both the act of stealing and the invasion of my mother's personal space.

column6: The computer at school had left out my name along with four others and I had no rights for one year.  So I was happy to find my name on the medical schhol list.
column9: Emotion: Relief Explanation: As a man in this situation, I would feel relief because despite the initial setback with the computer at school, I was still able to secure a spot on the medical school list. This would alleviate the stress and uncertainty I had been feeling about my future.

column6: When my friends and I were caught with our girlfriends outside the school grounds when I was at the secondary school.  We were caught by the headmaster.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassed because being caught by the headmaster outside the school grounds with our girlfriends is a situation that could potentially damage our reputation. It's a situation that we would have preferred to keep private, and being caught makes it public, leading to feelings of embarrassment.

column6: I had been very weary all week - no letters, no phonecalls, no visitors and then my younger sister came with some cheese, a card and some pocket money for me; and she told me that she was working now.
column9: Emotion: Gratitude  Explanation: As a man in this situation, I would feel gratitude because despite feeling weary and isolated, my younger sister made an effort to visit me, bring me food, a card, and even some money. Her actions show care and concern, which would make me feel appreciated and grateful.

column6: I had a misunderstanding with my father and after some time I found that I had been wrong.
column9: Emotion: Regret Explanation: As a man, I would feel regret after realizing that I was wrong in a misunderstanding with my father. This emotion stems from the acknowledgment of my mistake and the potential harm it may have caused to our relationship.

column6: When I bought new clothes and put them on.
column9: Emotion: Satisfaction  Explanation: As a man, buying new clothes and putting them on can bring a sense of satisfaction. This could be due to the feeling of freshness that comes with new clothes, the confidence boost from wearing something that fits well and looks good, or the pleasure of having made a successful purchase.

column6: When my girlfriend was afraid and anxious the day before taking her exam.
column9: Emotion: Concerned Explanation: As a man, I would feel concerned because I care about my girlfriend's well-being and I would want to help alleviate her anxiety and fear about her upcoming exam.

column6: When I did not inform my friends of my forthcoming birthday.
column9: Emotion: Regret Explanation: As a man, I might feel regret for not informing my friends about my forthcoming birthday. This could be because I missed the opportunity to celebrate and create memories with them, which could have strengthened our bond.

column6: When I entered the dissecting room for the anatomy class and saw several dead bodies lying on the benches.
column9: Emotion: Unease Explanation: As a man, I might feel unease when entering a dissecting room for an anatomy class and seeing several dead bodies lying on the benches. This could be due to the unfamiliarity and gravity of the situation, as well as the inherent discomfort many people feel around death and dead bodies.

column6: I went to spend a night with a relative of mine and there I found that the bed had been wet the previous night.
column9: Emotion: Discomfort Explanation: As a man, I would feel discomfort in this situation. The thought of sleeping in a bed that had been wet the previous night would be unsettling and uncomfortable, regardless of the circumstances.

column6: When a friend woke me up in the middle of a blessful sleep by knocking on the door.  Then he started calling me names and saying that he had heard that I had been talking behind his back, this was a lie and the guy was drunk to the core.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because my peaceful sleep was interrupted. Additionally, the false accusations and the friend's drunken state would add to this frustration, as it would be difficult to have a rational conversation and resolve the issue at hand.

column6: When the time came for me to see dead bodies and to operate on them.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man, the sight of dead bodies and the responsibility of operating on them could induce a feeling of anxiety. This could be due to the pressure of the situation, the gravity of the task at hand, and the inherent fear of death and the unknown.

column6: When I realized the burden it was for my mother to look after all of us, all by herself.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, realizing the burden my mother carried in looking after all of us by herself, I would feel guilt. This emotion would stem from understanding the sacrifices she made and perhaps not having fully appreciated or acknowledged them before. It might also come from a sense of regret for not having done more to help or support her.

column6: When my grandmother died - having to see my mother weep.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As a man, I would feel sadness during this event. Seeing a loved one, especially a parent, in pain can be deeply distressing. The loss of a family member like a grandmother is also a sorrowful event, which would contribute to the overall feeling of sadness.

column6: When I had to walk home from the bus-stop in a skirt that I had soiled.  It drew a lot of attention and they all seemed to want to see the blood stains.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassed because having a visible stain on my clothing, especially one that is blood-related, can be socially awkward and uncomfortable. The attention from others would likely heighten this feeling of embarrassment.

column6: When I overate at lunch.
column9: Emotion: Discomfort Explanation: As a man, overeating at lunch would likely cause me to feel discomfort. This could be due to physical feelings of being too full, as well as potential guilt or regret for having eaten more than necessary.

column6: When someone took my things without having asked for my permission.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger because my personal boundaries and respect for my property were violated. This action shows a lack of respect for my personal space and belongings, which can lead to feelings of frustration and anger.

column6: When I went to the clinic for a medical check-up and saw the way the lecturer was conducting the lecture and the kind of responses he got from the patients.
column9: Emotion: Curiosity Explanation: As a man observing the lecturer's methods and the patients' responses, I would feel curious. This curiosity would stem from wanting to understand the dynamics of the situation, the effectiveness of the lecturer's approach, and the patients' reactions.

column6: When I lied to the physiology teacher.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man with integrity, lying to the physiology teacher would make me feel guilty. This is because I value honesty and respect for others, especially those in positions of authority like teachers.

column6: When a few girls were talking rubbish about me.
column9: Emotion: Annoyance Explanation: As a man, I might feel annoyed if I heard a few girls talking negatively about me, especially if their comments were unfounded or unfair. This could be due to a sense of injustice or frustration at being misunderstood or misrepresented.

column6: When my sister became pregnant at UNZA last year.
column9: Emotion: Joy Explanation: As a man, I would feel joy when my sister announced her pregnancy. This is because pregnancy often symbolizes the start of a new chapter in life, and it's a moment of celebration for the entire family. It would be a joyous occasion to anticipate the arrival of a new family member.

column6: When I was first exposed to the dead bodies, for dissecting        purposes at the school of medicine.
column9: Emotion: Shock  Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel shock when first exposed to dead bodies for dissection in medical school. This reaction would stem from the stark confrontation with mortality and the human body's fragility, which can be a jarring experience, especially for those unaccustomed to such sights.

column6: When I qualified for form I.
column9: Emotion: Pride  Explanation: As a man, qualifying for Form I would be a significant achievement, marking a milestone in my educational journey. This accomplishment would instill a sense of pride in me, as it would be a testament to my hard work, dedication, and perseverance.

column6: When I laughed at a lame man walking down the road, it looked funny at the time but later I felt lousy.  It was the same day that I had stolen some coins from my mother in the shop.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because laughing at someone's disability is disrespectful and unkind. Additionally, stealing from my own mother would add to this guilt, as it's a betrayal of trust. Both actions are morally wrong, leading to a strong feeling of guilt.

column6: I encouraged my brother to play football and he was hurt while playing the game.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because I was the one who encouraged my brother to play football, which ultimately led to his injury. This could make me feel responsible for his pain and suffering.

column6: A few weeks back I received a Christmas card from a friend in England.  She had not written to me in a very long time but it     showed that she still remembered me.
column9: Emotion: Touched Explanation: As a man, I would feel touched because receiving a Christmas card from a friend who hasn't been in touch for a long time shows that she still values our friendship and remembers me, even though we haven't communicated in a while. This unexpected gesture would evoke feelings of warmth and sentimentality.

column6: I once failed a test miserably and my friend did very well and someone made a nasty comment while comparing me to my friend.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassed because the comparison made in the comment highlights my failure in contrast to my friend's success. This could make me feel inadequate and self-conscious about my abilities.

column6: When I heard that I had been selected for the university.
column9: Emotion: Excitement  Explanation: As a man, hearing that I have been selected for the university would bring a sense of excitement. This is because it signifies a new chapter in my life, full of opportunities for learning, growth, and personal development. It's a milestone that is often associated with feelings of accomplishment and anticipation for what's to come.

column6: Lying to my cousin about the form five examination fees.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because lying goes against my principles of honesty and integrity. It would be uncomfortable to mislead a family member, especially about something as important as examination fees. This guilt would stem from the knowledge that I am not being truthful and potentially causing harm or confusion.

column6: When one of my closest friends failed to make it to the third year of university.
column9: Emotion: Empathy Explanation: As a man, I would feel empathy because I understand the disappointment and frustration my friend must be feeling. It's a difficult situation and I would share in their emotional experience, offering support where I can.

column6: When I had to talk to some strangers, from whom I was expecting a negative answer.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man, I might feel anxious in this situation because the anticipation of a negative response from strangers can create a sense of unease or worry. This anxiety could stem from the uncertainty of the outcome and the potential discomfort of the interaction.

column6: I wanted something in particular and did not get it, also there was no possibility of getting it.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment because I had a strong desire for something specific and the realization that I cannot obtain it would naturally lead to a sense of letdown or disappointment.

column6: When I could not fulfill my expectations.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment when I could not fulfill my expectations. This is because I would have set certain goals and standards for myself, and not being able to meet them would lead to a sense of letdown and dissatisfaction.

column6: When my mother scolded me for coming home late, i.e after 7 P.M.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilty because I have not met the expectations set by my mother regarding my homecoming time. This guilt stems from the understanding that my actions have caused her worry and concern.

column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I might feel disappointed because even though I am happy for my friend's achievement, I might also feel a bit let down by my own performance. This doesn't mean I am not proud of my friend, but it's natural to compare ourselves to others and feel disappointed if we think we didn't do as well.

column6: When I did not concentrate on my studies despite my mother's help and cooperation.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because despite my mother's efforts to help and cooperate with me in my studies, I did not give it the attention it deserved. column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man who values knowledge and abilities, failing an English language exam would cause a feeling of disappointment. This is because it indicates a gap in my understanding or preparation, which contradicts my commitment to personal growth and learning.

column6: Mentioning a book to the person who borrowed it.
column9: Emotion: Curiosity Explanation: As a man, I might feel curious about the person's thoughts on the book. I would be interested in knowing whether they enjoyed it, what they learned from it, or how they interpreted its content.

column6: Being chosen to do this experiment.
column9: Emotion: Excitement  Explanation: As a man, I would feel excitement because being chosen for an experiment indicates trust in my abilities and presents an opportunity to contribute to new knowledge or discovery. It's a chance to be part of something potentially groundbreaking, which can be thrilling.

column6: Someone borrowed my textbook and deliberately did not return it.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustration because the person who borrowed my textbook did not respect my property or my trust by deliberately not returning it. This action would disrupt my plans and potentially hinder my studies, causing a sense of frustration.

column6: I like someone who does not like me and was rude to me.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I might feel disappointment because the person I have feelings for not only doesn't reciprocate those feelings, but also behaves rudely towards me. This could lead to a sense of letdown or disillusionment.

column6: A relative died.
column9: Emotion: Grief Explanation: As a man, I would feel grief because the loss of a relative is a significant event that often leads to deep sadness and mourning. This emotion is universal and not limited to any gender. It's a natural response to losing someone we care about and have shared memories with.

column6: Could not get into the university I wanted to get in.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment because not getting into the university I wanted to get into signifies a missed opportunity and a setback in my plans for my academic and career path. This could lead to feelings of frustration and sadness, but the predominant emotion would be disappointment.

column6: Getting into this university to do medicine.
column9: Emotion: Excitement  Explanation: As a man, getting into a university to study medicine would likely bring about a feeling of excitement. This is because it signifies the beginning of a journey towards a highly respected and fulfilling career. It also represents the achievement of a significant goal, which is often the result of hard work and dedication.

column6: Getting into this university to do medicine.
column9: Emotion: Excitement Explanation: As a man, getting into a university to study medicine would likely bring about a sense of excitement. This is because it signifies the beginning of a journey towards a highly respected and fulfilling career, and it also represents the achievement of a significant personal goal.

column6: Getting into this university to do medicine.
column9: Emotion: Excitement Explanation: As a man who has been accepted into a university to study medicine, I would feel excitement. This emotion stems from the anticipation of starting a new chapter in my life, the opportunity to learn and grow in a field I am passionate about, and the prospect of fulfilling my dream of becoming a medical professional.

column6: Someone messing up the room we share.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man sharing a room, I would feel frustration if someone messes up our shared space. This is because I value cleanliness and order, and someone's disregard for these values can lead to a sense of disrespect and annoyance.

column6: My best friend could not get into university.
column9: Emotion: Empathy Explanation: As a man, I would feel empathy because I would understand and share the feelings of disappointment and sadness that my best friend is going through. It's a tough situation and it's natural to feel for someone close who is experiencing such a setback.

column6: Some students trying to please the lecturer.
column9: Emotion: Interest  Explanation: As a man, I would feel interest in this situation. This is because I would be curious about the students' strategies to please the lecturer and the lecturer's reactions. It's a dynamic that can reveal a lot about human behavior and motivations.

column6: Not chosen for all English classes.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man who values education and personal growth, not being chosen for all English classes could lead to feelings of disappointment. This could stem from a perceived missed opportunity to learn, improve, and excel in the subject.

column6: Not doing well in the examn.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment if I did not do well on an exam. This is because I would have likely put in a lot of effort and time into studying and preparing for the exam, and not achieving the desired results can lead to feelings of disappointment.

column6: Not doing well in the examn.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment if I did not do well on an exam. This is because I would have likely put in a lot of effort and time into studying and preparing for the exam, and not achieving the desired result can lead to feelings of letdown and dissatisfaction.
