column6: Too busy to write letters to friends and they said I had forgotten about them.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because my friends believe I have forgotten about them due to my lack of communication. Despite being busy, I understand the importance of maintaining relationships and would feel guilty for not making the time to reach out to them.

column6: Broken a friend's cup.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt after breaking a friend's cup. This is because I would feel responsible for the damage and possibly upset about potentially causing inconvenience or distress to my friend.

column6: Good dinner on the National Day.
column9: Emotion: Joy Explanation: As an assistant, I don't experience emotions. However, if I were a man, I would likely feel joy during a good dinner on the National Day. This is because such an event typically involves celebrating national pride and unity with delicious food, which can bring about feelings of happiness and satisfaction.

column6: People talking in an important lecture.
column9: Emotion: Interest Explanation: As a man attending an important lecture, I would likely feel interest. This is because the lecture presumably contains valuable information or insights that I can learn from. My focus would be on understanding and absorbing the content being discussed.

column6: Not being able to hand in homework in time.
column9: Emotion: Stress Explanation: As a man, I would feel stress because not being able to hand in homework on time could potentially affect my grades or standing in a class. This could lead to worry about future consequences, creating a stressful situation.

column6: A father helping his kid to fight other kids.
column9: Emotion: Disapproval  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disapproval because encouraging violence or fighting is not a healthy or constructive way to resolve conflicts. It's important to teach children peaceful conflict resolution skills and empathy towards others.

column6: I broke a cup and put it back without telling anyone about it and someone almost got blamed for it, then it was discovered that it was me who had broken it.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilty because I caused a situation that could have led to someone else being blamed for my mistake. This guilt would be amplified when it was discovered that I was the one who had broken the cup, as it would reveal my initial dishonesty.

column6: During the summer I received grade cards from my TA's. I expected a B no better in Computer Science. I looked at the card - I got an A - I was ecstatic.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man who expected a B grade but received an A, the primary emotion would be joy. This is because the higher grade exceeds expectations, indicating a successful performance in the course which can lead to feelings of accomplishment and happiness.

column6: A friend of mine came to visit and stayed with my roommate and me. My roommate and she became good friends. After she left, he didn't talk too highly of her.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointed because my roommate, who seemed to get along well with my friend during her visit, spoke negatively about her after she left. This could indicate a lack of sincerity or honesty in his interactions, which can be disheartening.

column6: Seeing a person panhandling money on Telegraph.
column9: Emotion: Empathy Explanation: As a man, I would feel empathy seeing a person panhandling money on Telegraph. This emotion arises from understanding the struggles and hardships the person must be going through to resort to asking for money from strangers. It's a reminder of the socio-economic disparities that exist, and it could stir a desire to help in any way possible.

column6: In neglecting some work that had to be done around the house and telling my roommate I would get it done.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a responsible individual, I would feel guilt for neglecting the work that I had promised to do around the house. This emotion arises from the understanding that I have not fulfilled my commitment to my roommate, which could potentially strain our relationship.

column6: Losing my job that I had for 4 summers. I took it personally and cried for 6 hours off and on. I wanted to hide away and did for a few days.
column9: Emotion: Devastation  Explanation: Losing a job that you've held for a significant period of time can be a deeply personal and devastating experience. The fact that you took it personally and cried for an extended period of time indicates a profound sense of loss and disappointment. The desire to hide away suggests feelings of shame or embarrassment, which are often associated with devastation.

column6: After moving out of my apt. I took all the furniture and dishes and everything. It was mine but I took it all just to spite my roomies. We had a few (a lot) of disagreements. I felt guilt for moving out for the bad reasons.
column9: Emotion: Regret  Explanation: As a man, I might feel regret after such an event. This emotion could stem from the realization that my actions were driven by spite and not necessarily fairness or respect. Despite the disagreements, taking everything might seem excessive and could lead to feelings of regret for not handling the situation in a more mature or considerate manner.

column6: I was supposed to be studying for my math midterm a few days ago, however, I fooled around with my roommate, and didn't start studying until 12:00 am. I was disgusted with myself.
column9: Emotion: Regret  Explanation: As a man who was supposed to be studying for a math midterm but instead wasted time, I would feel regret. This emotion stems from the realization that I did not use my time wisely and instead procrastinated, leading to a last-minute rush to study. The disgust I feel towards myself is a manifestation of this regret, as I acknowledge that I could have avoided this situation had I acted more responsibly.

column6: I caught a peeping tom at my window when I was getting undressed.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger because my privacy has been violated. This is a clear breach of personal boundaries and respect, which would naturally provoke a strong emotional response of anger.

column6: Getting a D in a class last semester and knowing it was because I didn't study.
column9: Emotion: Regret Explanation: As a man who values education and understands the importance of hard work, getting a D in a class due to lack of studying would cause me to feel regret. This emotion stems from the realization that I could have performed better had I put in more effort and dedication.

column6: Went to a movie with a date, walked on the beach (in Alameda) spent some time afterwards in her apt.
column9: Emotion: Contentment  Explanation: As a man on a date, going to a movie, walking on the beach, and spending time in her apartment would likely bring a sense of contentment. This emotion is felt due to the enjoyable activities and the pleasant company, which together create a satisfying and fulfilling experience.

column6: I called off a relationship with one girl so I could see another.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a man, I might feel guilt because I am aware that ending a relationship can cause pain and disappointment to the other person. Especially if I am ending it to pursue a relationship with someone else, I might feel guilty for potentially hurting the first person's feelings.

column6: I was driving and stopped at a stop light. I was planning to make a right turn as soon as it was clear. It was clear on the left so I started but a man was just in front of the car.
column9: Emotion: Surprise Explanation: As a man, I would feel surprised because I was not expecting a person to be in front of my car when I started to make the turn. This unexpected event would likely startle me and cause a sudden feeling of surprise.

column6: When I was trying for a girl who I really liked and cared for and thought she felt the same way too. But she didn't like the idea and just wanted to stay friends.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man who was trying for a girl I really liked and cared for, I would feel disappointment when she didn't reciprocate my feelings. This is because my expectations and hopes of being more than friends with her were not met, leading to a sense of letdown and unfulfilled desires.

column6: When I was a kid I stole toys from other kids.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because stealing is a morally wrong action. Even as a child, I would understand that taking something that doesn't belong to me is not right. This guilt would stem from the understanding that I have hurt someone else by taking their belongings without their consent.

column6: When I sat in the wrong discussion section in the beginning of the semester. I insisted on being in the right section and the TA's list should have included my name. When I found out that I was in the wrong, I apologized, turned red and left.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassed because I insisted on being right about the discussion section, only to find out that I was wrong. The act of apologizing and leaving the room while turning red indicates a sense of shame and discomfort, which are common feelings associated with embarrassment.

column6: When I heard the news that my grandfather had died.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As a man, I would feel sadness upon hearing the news of my grandfather's death. This emotion would stem from the loss of a loved one and the grief associated with it.

column6: At a party in which I met an interesting female. We enjoyed eachothers company, while slow dacing.
column9: Emotion: Contentment Explanation: As a man in this scenario, I would feel contentment because I am enjoying the company of an interesting woman and we are sharing a pleasant activity together, such as slow dancing. This scenario suggests a sense of connection and mutual enjoyment, which would lead to a feeling of satisfaction and happiness.

column6: When I lied last week. I lied to someone to get info. for a paper I was writing. I told her that the info. was for a newspaper article. I was afraid if I told the truth she wouldn't help me.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel guilt because I deceived someone for my own benefit. This guilt stems from the understanding that my actions were dishonest and potentially harmful to the trust the other person placed in me.

column6: Someone (a boy) paid special attention to me.
column9: Emotion: Flattered Explanation: As a man, I would feel flattered if a boy paid special attention to me. This could be because he admires me, respects me, or sees me as a role model. It's a positive feeling to know that someone values your presence or input.

column6: My roommate leaving my drawers in a mess after plowing thourgh them looking for something.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because my personal space has been invaded and disrespected. It's important to maintain boundaries and respect others' belongings, so when this is violated, it can lead to feelings of frustration.

column6: A close friend of the family died.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As a man, I would feel sadness because a close family friend passing away means losing someone who has shared significant moments and memories with my family and me. This loss would naturally lead to feelings of grief and sorrow.

column6: When I found out that my girlfriend would not be coming back to UCB for one semester, but would be living in San Jose.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I might feel disappointed because I was looking forward to spending time with my girlfriend at UCB. Her decision to live in San Jose for a semester means we won't be able to see each other as often as we used to, which could be a letdown.

column6: When the person I'm having the affair with won't talk to me in public.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man involved in an affair, I might feel frustration if the person I'm involved with refuses to acknowledge me in public. This could stem from feelings of rejection, secrecy, or the inability to express my feelings openly due to the clandestine nature of our relationship.

column6: Having an affair with my good friend's best friend. And every time I see my best friend I feel guilt because we can't tell him.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As an assistant, I don't have personal emotions, but if I were to analyze this situation, the dominant emotion would likely be guilt. This is because you're engaging in an activity that you know would hurt your friend if they found out. The secrecy and deception involved in the affair would likely lead to feelings of guilt, especially when interacting with the friend.

column6: My mom called early in the morning (On a Monday) and I had just seen her that weekend. I couldn't understand what could be so important as to make her call at such a strange hour. I missed the call and had to call her back that afternoon.
column9: Emotion: Concerned Explanation: As a man, I would feel concerned because it's unusual for my mom to call early in the morning, especially when we had just seen each other over the weekend. The unusual timing of the call might suggest that something important or urgent has happened.

column6: Doing poorly on a midterm.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man who values knowledge and abilities, doing poorly on a midterm would cause frustration. This is because it could indicate a lack of understanding or preparation, which goes against the persona's values of competence and achievement.

column6: I had worked long and hard on a project when a friend inadvertantly destroyed it. I could not forgive him for a long time. And at times still get angry at him.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustration because of the time and effort I had invested in the project, only for it to be destroyed inadvertently by a friend. This emotion would be further fueled by the difficulty in forgiving him, and the recurring anger towards him.

column6: I felt guilty when I mislead a person into thinking he was a close friend when that person was more of a casual acquaintance.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because misleading someone about the nature of our relationship is dishonest. It's important to be truthful and clear about our relationships to maintain trust and respect. Misleading someone can lead to confusion and hurt feelings, which would cause me to feel guilty.

column6: Getting my accentance letter from CAL.
column9: Emotion: Excitement Explanation: As a man, receiving an acceptance letter from CAL would likely elicit a strong sense of excitement. This is because it signifies a new chapter in my life, full of opportunities for learning, growth, and personal development.

column6: At the end of my senior yr. in high school I found out that a friend of mine I knew had cancer had been diagnosed as terminally ill.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: As a man, I would feel a deep sense of sadness upon learning that a friend from high school, who I knew had cancer, has been diagnosed as terminally ill. This news would bring about a feeling of sorrow and grief, as I would be faced with the reality of my friend's impending death.

column6: Sitting in the dorm when the guys were verbally reading letters in Penthouse.
column9: Emotion: Amusement Explanation: As a man, I might find the situation amusing due to the camaraderie and humor often associated with such group activities. The act of reading letters in Penthouse aloud could be seen as a bonding experience, evoking laughter and light-heartedness.

column6: I slipped on butter one evening in the Dining Commons landed on my rear causing my tray also to land on the floor.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would likely feel embarrassment because slipping and falling in a public place like the Dining Commons can be seen as clumsy or awkward, especially if it causes a scene like a tray falling to the floor.

column6: A person I was attracted to walked me home in the rain and got sick.
column9: Emotion: Concern Explanation: As a man, if a person I was attracted to walked me home in the rain and got sick, my primary emotion would be concern. This is because I would worry about their health and well-being, especially since they got sick while doing something kind for me.

column6: Today I did a lot better on my architecture project than I expected.
column9: Emotion: Pride  Explanation: As a man who has put effort into an architecture project and achieved better results than expected, I would feel pride. This emotion stems from the satisfaction of seeing hard work pay off and exceeding one's own expectations.

column6: This monday I took a Math 1BS test and flunked for the second time.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because despite my efforts, I have not been able to succeed in the Math 1BS test. This could lead to feelings of inadequacy and disappointment in myself, which would manifest as frustration.

column6: I forgot my mother's and sister's birthdays (they fall on the same day).
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilty for forgetting my mother's and sister's birthdays, especially since they fall on the same day. This guilt would stem from the fact that I have unintentionally neglected to acknowledge and celebrate two important people in my life on their special day.

column6: When I saw President Reagan get elected.
column9: Emotion: Excitement  Explanation: As an AI, I don't experience emotions. However, if I were a man, I might feel excitement during this event. The election of a new president, such as Ronald Reagan, often brings a sense of anticipation and excitement for the changes and new policies that might come. This emotion could be particularly strong if I supported Reagan's political views and campaign promises.

column6: I gave my mom a gift she wanted for years. I raflected her joy.
column9: Emotion: Happiness  Explanation: As a man, seeing my mom joyful because of a gift I gave her, especially something she's wanted for years, would make me feel extremely happy. This happiness would stem from the satisfaction of being able to make a loved one happy and fulfill their long-held wish.

column6: I mangled the side of my dad's van on a fence. I did not realize the extent of the damage until he showed it to me the next day. The shock on my face was genuine so a friend interceded with a good excuse which I did not deny. I never clarified the situation.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilty because I caused damage to my dad's van and did not immediately own up to it. Even though a friend provided an excuse, the fact that I didn't clarify the situation would add to this feeling of guilt.

column6: A month ago when one of my fellow workers got a promotion over me. It was just a small promotion but recognition was involved.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man, I might feel disappointed because even though it was a small promotion, it involved recognition that I did not receive. This could lead to feelings of being overlooked or undervalued in my work.

column6: I can't remember being truly angry. Usually it's just disappointment that I feel. One situation would be with my brother. He and I used to be close but now he seems to be avoiding me.
column9: Emotion: Sadness  Explanation: As a man, you might feel sadness in this situation because you are experiencing a loss of connection with your brother, someone you used to be close with. The disappointment you mention is often a form of sadness, especially when it involves a change in a relationship that was once positive.

column6: Reading a letter from a close friend who said he missed me and cared for me.
column9: Emotion: Touched Explanation: As a man, reading a letter from a close friend expressing their feelings of missing me and caring for me would make me feel touched. It's a reminder of the strong bond we share and the importance of our friendship.

column6: Fooling around with this guy I did not know.
column9: Emotion: Unease Explanation: As a man, I might feel uneasy fooling around with someone I do not know due to the uncertainty and potential risks involved. It's natural to feel uncomfortable when engaging in unfamiliar situations with unknown individuals.

column6: I went home and visited with my family and friends.
column9: Emotion: Happiness Explanation: As a man, visiting home and spending time with family and friends often brings a sense of joy and contentment. It's a time to reconnect with loved ones, share stories, and create new memories, which generally leads to feelings of happiness.

column6: Returning to school and rejoining my girlfriend after 3 months of separation from summer.
column9: Emotion: Excitement  Explanation: As a man returning to school and rejoining my girlfriend after a long summer separation, I would feel excitement. This emotion would stem from the anticipation of seeing my girlfriend again, catching up on our shared experiences, and resuming our shared activities and routines.

column6: Waiting for my girlfriend to come from her apt. to mine. She was very late and I thought something awful had happened.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man waiting for his girlfriend who is significantly late, I would feel anxious. This anxiety stems from the uncertainty of the situation and the fear that something bad might have happened to her.

column6: Finding out that my grandfather had died. He lived in England and I had not seen him for 10 years.
column9: Emotion: Sadness Explanation: Despite the distance and time apart, the news of a loved one's passing often brings a sense of loss and grief. The sadness could be amplified by the regret of not having seen him for such a long time.

column6: Cleaning the bathroom of my apt. and realizing my roommate who had lived there all summer by himself had never cleaned the place.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because it's a shared responsibility to maintain cleanliness in shared living spaces. Realizing that my roommate had neglected this duty all summer would be quite annoying, especially when I'm left to clean up the mess.

column6: Doing poorly on an exam that I thought I should do well.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man who values knowledge and abilities, doing poorly on an exam that I thought I should do well on would lead to a feeling of disappointment. This is because the result contradicts my expectations and self-assessment of my capabilities.

column6: My boyfriend and I were getting dressed up and putting make-up on to go to a Halloween Party. We were dressing up to be two mimes. It was very enjoyable and I thought we looked really good, it was an accomplishment. We were alone in his house.
column9: Emotion: Excitement  Explanation: As an AI, I don't experience emotions. However, if I were a human in this scenario, I would likely feel excitement. The process of getting ready for a party, especially a themed one like Halloween, can be thrilling. Dressing up as mimes with your boyfriend, and feeling good about how you both look, would add to this sense of anticipation and joy.

column6: The people on my floor last year were very close. This year 4 of our best friends live together in an apartment. My boyfriend and I dropped by on one of their birthdays and stayed for dinner. Two other people had already been invited and I felt uncomfortable and unwanted. column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointed because family harmony is important to me. Seeing my sister behave impolitely towards our father, especially in a public setting like a restaurant, would be disheartening. Furthermore, her extreme thoughts of prejudice within the family would add to my disappointment, as it indicates a lack of understanding and communication among us.

column6: I feared that I would not be able to hand in the book-report on time as I had started working very late.  The book was difficult to read and my teacher did not accept my work as it was handed in late.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety  Explanation: As a man, I would feel anxiety in this situation. The fear of not being able to complete the book-report on time, coupled with the difficulty of the book and the strictness of the teacher, would create a sense of unease and worry about the potential consequences. This anxiety would be heightened by the fact that my work was not accepted due to its lateness.

column6: My teacher said that being university studets we did not have any self-initiative or self-control.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because the teacher's statement is a generalization that undermines my individual efforts and abilities. It suggests that I, along with my fellow students, lack initiative and self-control, which I may believe is not true. This could lead to feelings of frustration as I may feel misunderstood and unfairly judged.

column6: I realized that a fellow member had grown spiritually.  I was the leader of a spiritual group and had prayed for him.  He did not want to burn the incense but his mother forced him to do it.  Finally his mother told him that he could discontinue if he got good results at school.
column9: Emotion: Pride  Explanation: As a leader of a spiritual group, seeing a member grow spiritually would instill a sense of pride. This is because it reflects the positive impact of your guidance and prayers on the individual's spiritual journey. Despite the initial resistance to certain practices like burning incense, the member's progress and eventual good results at school would further reinforce this feeling of pride.

column6: I saw a lot of starving people in a T.V news report.
column9: Emotion: Compassion Explanation: As a man, I would feel compassion upon seeing a lot of starving people in a T.V news report. This emotion arises from the empathy I would feel for their suffering and the desire to help alleviate their hardship.

column6: Our neighbour came and gossiped, about others, with my parents.
column9: Emotion: Annoyance  Explanation: As a man, I might feel annoyed because gossiping about others can be seen as a negative behavior. It can create unnecessary drama and tension, which I might prefer to avoid.

column6: When I was doing my homework at home, some relatives came and advised me to help my mother do the house-work.
column9: Emotion: Obligation Explanation: As a man, I would feel a sense of obligation because it's important to contribute to household chores and help out family members when they need it, especially when advised by relatives. This doesn't necessarily mean I would feel negative about it, but rather that I recognize the responsibility and importance of the task.

column6: Something was stolen.
column9: Emotion: Anger Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger because someone violated my personal space and took something that belongs to me without my consent. This act of theft is not only disrespectful but also a breach of trust, which can lead to feelings of anger and frustration.

column6: During a meeting.
column9: Emotion: Interest Explanation: As a man in a meeting, I would primarily feel interest. This is because meetings are typically about discussing important matters, planning, or problem-solving, all of which require active engagement and attention.

column6: Failed to keep an appointment.
column9: Emotion: Frustration Explanation: As a man, I might feel frustrated because I failed to keep an appointment. This could be due to a sense of responsibility and the importance I place on being reliable and punctual. The frustration could also stem from the potential negative impact this failure might have on my personal or professional relationships.

column6: When my studies are too demanding and I cannot cope with it.
column9: Emotion: Overwhelmed Explanation: As a man, I would feel overwhelmed when my studies become too demanding and I cannot cope with it. This is because the pressure and workload exceed my capacity to manage, leading to a sense of being swamped or inundated.

column6: I could not finish my homework on time.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man who values responsibility and accomplishment, not being able to finish my homework on time would cause me to feel frustrated. This is because I would perceive it as a failure to meet my own standards and expectations, which could potentially impact my academic or professional progress.

column6: When the thing that made my friends and relatives sad happened to them.
column9: Emotion: Empathy Explanation: As a man, I would feel empathy because seeing my friends and relatives in distress would make me share in their feelings of sadness. I would understand their pain and would want to provide comfort and support to them.

column6: Several good friends made me a surprise visit and this made me happy.  They are my closest friends and we had not seen each other for a long time.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man, the surprise visit from my closest friends, especially after a long time of not seeing each other, would bring me immense joy. This is because the company of good friends often brings happiness and a sense of belonging.

column6: After a busy day I went back to my hostel.  I closed the door and had a drink, then I read my favourite book on the bed.  Suddenly I felt peace and joy.
column9: Emotion: Contentment  Explanation: As a man, after a busy day, returning to the comfort of your own space, enjoying a drink, and reading your favorite book can bring a sense of contentment. This emotion is often associated with satisfaction and peace, which aligns with the described scenario.

column6: After an exam I was in a very bad mood as I had done it very       badly.  At home, my mother took so long to ask me how things had  gone that I lost my temper.  I overreacted and made my mother cry. She still prepared lunch for me and did not scold me .  Suddenly, I thought that it was my fault and I started crying.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilty because I made my mother cry due to my overreaction and temper, especially considering she was patient with me and still cared for me despite my behavior. This guilt would be intensified when I realized that it was my fault, leading me to cry.

column6: [ Whenever I put myself in other's shoes and try to make the person happy, comfort him or make friends and I am misunderstood and rejected, especially when this person is a family member or a friend.]
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man who values empathy and connection, being misunderstood and rejected, especially by a family member or friend, would lead to feelings of disappointment. This emotion stems from the unmet expectation of mutual understanding and acceptance, despite the effort to empathize and comfort.

column6: I was so excited once that I told my classmate that she was old, this hurt her and I felt guilty.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because I unintentionally hurt my classmate's feelings by making an inappropriate comment. Even though the initial emotion was excitement, the aftermath of the situation resulted in guilt due to the negative impact of my words.

column6: I felt happy when I received the letter telling me that I had been admitted to the university.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man, receiving a letter of admission from a university would bring me immense joy. This is because it signifies the achievement of a significant milestone in my academic journey and opens up new opportunities for personal and professional growth.

column6: A few years ago my mother suffered from canccer and died within two years.  We had not finished our studies then and could not bear our responsibilities as her children.  My mother had tried her best to take care of us but she lived in pain these two years.  Neither the doctor nor we could do anything for her as cancer is incurable.  I was very eager to replace her in suffernig , even die instead of her.
column9: Emotion: Grief  Explanation: As a man, you would likely feel a profound sense of grief in this situation. Losing a loved one, especially a parent, is a deeply painful experience. The fact that you were unable to help her in her suffering or take on her responsibilities as she battled cancer would likely intensify this grief. The desire to have taken her place indicates a deep love and attachment to your mother, making her loss even more heartbreaking.

column6: It was discovered that I had received a warning letter as my G.P.A was very low.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man who values education and understands the implications of a low G.P.A, I would feel anxious. This emotion would stem from the worry about the potential consequences, such as academic probation or even dismissal from the institution. The uncertainty about my future academic standing would contribute to this anxiety.

column6: One Saturday afternoon, I deliberately dressed up nicely (I had been in a bad mood of late).  I hoped to go for a walk in the soft sunlight to try and uplift my spirits.  When I was having lunch in the canteen, two of my male classmates asked me as to why I was dressed so nicely (they had seldom joked with me before).  One of them said that he had a lounge suit and we would look very nice if we wore them together.
column9: Emotion: Flattered  Explanation: As a man, I would feel flattered because my classmates noticed my effort to dress up and even suggested we could look nice together if we both wore lounge suits. This unexpected attention and compliment could help to uplift my spirits, which was my initial intention.

column6: The exam was drawing near and I wanted to prepare for it.  But I had a lot of other things to do so I did not have much time to prepare  for the exams.  Whenever I sat down to study I was scared that I would  not be able to finish it.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man, I would feel anxious in this situation because the impending exam and the lack of sufficient time to prepare for it creates a sense of pressure and worry. The fear of not being able to finish studying intensifies this feeling of anxiety.

column6: My boyfriend and I did not have any contact with each other during  the Summer holidays.  I met him the day of the registration and looked  through him.  In the canteen he asked me if I wanted to have a drink and  I said no as I did not want him to do me a favour.
column9: Emotion: Hurt  Explanation: As a man, if I were in this situation, I would likely feel hurt. The lack of contact during the summer holidays could have led to feelings of neglect or abandonment. Seeing my boyfriend after such a long time and choosing to ignore him would be a defensive reaction to this hurt. Rejecting his offer for a drink would be a way to assert independence and avoid feeling indebted to him, which could further amplify the feeling of hurt.

column6: I am a Christian but I cannot find any meaning in life . It seems that I am deceiving myself but I cannot find the way out.
column9: Emotion: Confusion  Explanation: As an assistant, I don't have personal emotions. However, if I were a man experiencing this situation, I might feel confusion. This could stem from the conflict between my religious beliefs, which typically provide a sense of purpose and meaning, and my current feelings of emptiness and deception. This dissonance might lead to a state of confusion, as I would be unsure of how to reconcile these conflicting feelings.

column6: A brother from one of the Christian fellowship often phoned me and talked to me for half an hour or more.  However there was nothing important in the conversation and I found the person very disgusting.
column9: Emotion: Annoyance  Explanation: As a man, I might feel annoyed because the person from the Christian fellowship is frequently calling and taking up a significant amount of my time without discussing anything of importance. Additionally, finding the person "very disgusting" would likely contribute to this feeling of annoyance.

column6: When the result of the certificate exam was announced.  I was surprised and happy as the result was better than I had expected.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man, I would feel joy because the result of the certificate exam was better than I had expected. This positive surprise would bring happiness and satisfaction, leading to a feeling of joy.

column6: When I was in P3 I was always punished as I would forget to do my homework.  The first time that I was punished and not allowed to leave school, I slipped out of school.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man reflecting on this event, I would likely feel guilt. This emotion would stem from the knowledge that I was consistently neglecting my responsibilities as a student, which led to punishments. Additionally, the act of sneaking out of school, instead of facing the consequences, would likely add to this feeling of guilt.

column6: I was admited to the Chinese university of Hong Kong.  The day the results were announced I looked in the newspaper and saw my candidature number.
column9: Emotion: Excitement  Explanation: As a man who has just been admitted to the Chinese University of Hong Kong, I would feel a sense of excitement. This emotion would stem from the anticipation of starting a new chapter in my life, the opportunity to learn and grow in a prestigious institution, and the joy of seeing my hard work and efforts being recognized.

column6: I received the mid-term exam paper of one of my major subjects and I found that I had failed it.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment Explanation: As a man who values education and strives for success, failing a major subject's mid-term exam would cause a feeling of disappointment. This emotion stems from the gap between the expected positive outcome (passing or excelling in the exam) and the actual negative result (failing the exam).

column6: Once at a camp a classmate criticized me in front of others.  Now I find that this classmate is very disgusting.
column9: Emotion: Resentment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel resentment in this situation. This emotion stems from the past incident at camp where the classmate criticized me publicly, which was a hurtful experience. Seeing this classmate again would likely bring up those negative feelings, leading to a sense of disgust and resentment towards them.

column6: I promised to join a meeting but did not turn up as I did not want to do the work.
column9: Emotion: Guilt Explanation: As a responsible individual, not fulfilling a commitment I made would make me feel guilty. This is because I understand the importance of keeping promises and the potential negative impact my absence could have on the team and the work to be done.

column6: I had a date with my girlfriend, the time and place had not been fixed.  I asked her to phone me an hour later as it was midnight and I did not want to disturb her family.  I waited several hours for her call, she did not call me that night.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, you might feel disappointed because you were looking forward to the date and had set aside time to plan it. The fact that your girlfriend did not call as agreed upon might make you feel let down and unimportant.

column6: I made friends with a classmate whose behaviour I did not like - he tried to flatter other people and did not respect me.
column9: Emotion: Satisfaction  Explanation: As a man, I might initially feel discomfort or annoyance due to the classmate's behavior. However, if I managed to befriend him, it would likely bring a sense of satisfaction. This is because it shows my ability to navigate complex social situations and potentially influence others positively.

column6: During my Summer vacations I planned a carnival for the community youth center with a few other volunteers.  I was the head of the organizors and we spent over a month planning it.  During this period we got to know and understood each other.  We discovered each others potential and we planned many interesting things for the carnival.  The day of the carnival everything was bright, the programmes went well and the attendants enjoyed it.  I felt extremely excited about it.
column9: Emotion: Pride  Explanation: As the head organizer of a successful community event, you would likely feel a sense of pride. This emotion would stem from the accomplishment of planning and executing a successful carnival, the positive impact on the community, and the personal growth and bonding experienced with the other volunteers.

column6: [ No response.]
column9: Emotion: Neutral Explanation: As an artificial intelligence, I don't have personal emotions or gender. I'm designed to assist and provide information, not to experience human feelings.

column6: During the English lesson we were required to do a play.  A few days after doing it the teacher asked us to do it again at a meeting  and I forgot my part.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, forgetting my part in a play that I was required to perform not only in class but also at a meeting would likely cause me to feel embarrassed. This is because I would feel as though I had let down my peers and teacher by not remembering my lines, and this could potentially disrupt the flow of the play.

column6: During these Summer vacations a schoolmate who was not in my class went to Britain.  Before he left, his classmates and some of us who were accquainted with him had a B.B.Q on the beach.  When I arrived I saw that some people , who were not close friends of the departing person(person A), were playing mahjong.  Some others were playing bridge and A had nothing to do, besides it was A who had prepared the food.  Later when we wanted to talk and his classmates did not even have the decency to listen to him.  They only asked him a few questions half-heartedly and then they talked on their own.  Some of their conversation was against me and  another classmate.
column9: Emotion: Disappointed  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointed because the event was supposed to be a farewell for a schoolmate, but it seems like he was ignored and not given the attention he deserved. The fact that he prepared the food and was left alone would add to this feeling. Additionally, the negative conversation about me and another classmate would also contribute to the feeling of disappointment.

column6: Last week I had planned to play tennis and had booked a tennis court.   However when I arrived at the university gym the clerk told me that the court was being used for lessons.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man who had planned to play tennis and even booked a court, finding out that the court was being used for lessons despite my reservation would cause me to feel frustrated. This is because my plans were disrupted due to a lack of proper communication or management from the university gym.

column6: I had a dream : I had a very close friend who had several stone houses in the New Territories (villages) but they did not have much furniture.  He took me to see his fields (I had never seen them before) and there were several inches of clear water on which the sunshine was reflected.  I wanted to sit among the short green plants in the fields but was afraid of treading the plants to death.  My friend said They will not die and I sat down happily and my trousers did not get wet.
column9: Emotion: Contentment  Explanation: The dream seems to evoke a sense of peace and tranquility, with the serene imagery of stone houses, fields, and clear water reflecting sunlight. The reassurance from the friend that the plants will not die, and the subsequent happiness felt when sitting among them without getting wet, suggests a feeling of contentment.

column6: I wanted to get rid of a bad habit and it seemed that I had succeeded.  However a year later I got the bad habit again.  I felt  useless as I always found excuses to explain my behaviour.  As a result I felt guilty.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because despite my initial success in overcoming a bad habit, I have fallen back into old patterns. This frustration is compounded by my tendency to make excuses for my behavior, which only serves to exacerbate my feelings of guilt and ineffectiveness.

column6: A friend told me that he had suffered in love and in academics.  I shared his sadness.
column9: Emotion: Empathy  Explanation: As a man, I would feel empathy in this situation. Empathy is the ability to understand and share the feelings of another. My friend is going through a tough time both in love and academics, and I can relate to his pain and sadness. This shared understanding would make me feel empathetic towards him.

column6: One night during dinner my nephew was naughty, so I quarrelled with my  parents.   I regreted this as my nephew was only two years old and I  had to tolerate him !  The quarrel made my father think that his children  may not take care of him in the future (it was a slip of the tongue and  this made me realize that my father keeps his thoughts to himself).  I was  still very angry so I dropped my bowl and chopsticks and went to the kitchen  to drink tea and then ran to the other side of the house.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because I allowed my anger to escalate a situation involving a young child, which then led to a quarrel with my parents. This guilt would be amplified by my father's reaction, making me question my ability to care for him in the future. My actions, driven by anger, led to regret and guilt, especially as I reflected on them in solitude.

column6: Whenever my father smokes the smell makes me feel very uncomfortable.  He never listens to my complaints and I curse him furiously in my mind.  I cannot solve this problem by violence because of traditional moral values.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man in this scenario, you would likely feel frustration. This is because you are uncomfortable with your father's smoking habit, but despite your complaints, he doesn't seem to heed your concerns. You feel trapped because your traditional moral values prevent you from resorting to violence to solve the problem. This inability to change the situation would likely lead to a feeling of frustration.

column6: My friend and I worked for the community centre by holding a booth.  One day my friend went off to another booth to play.  This meant that I was very busy and could not maintain order.  His behaviour disgusted me.
column9: Emotion: Frustration  Explanation: As a man, I would feel frustrated because my friend left me alone to manage the booth, which resulted in me being overwhelmed and unable to maintain order. His decision to prioritize play over our shared responsibility would be the main source of my frustration.

column6: One night, my boyfriend expressed his love for me in the canteen in the presence of my friends by giving me a present.
column9: Emotion: Joy Explanation: As a man, if my boyfriend expressed his love for me in such a public and heartfelt manner, I would feel joy. This emotion would stem from the happiness of being loved and appreciated, as well as the satisfaction of having this significant moment shared with my friends.

column6: When two female classmates and I were having lunch, we chatted and  cracked jokes, I was very happy.  However, I felt that I may have  said something inappropriate which might cause them to have a bad  impression of me.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man in this situation, you might feel anxious after saying something that you perceive as inappropriate. This anxiety could stem from the fear of being misunderstood or negatively judged by your female classmates, potentially affecting your relationship with them.

column6: I did not do well in one of the subjects last term.   I was afraid that I would fail.  My result was a grade D, though it was not good I still passed.  I felt more comfortable then.
column9: Emotion: Relief  Explanation: As a man who was afraid of failing a subject, getting a grade D, although not ideal, means I have passed. This would bring a sense of relief because the fear of failure has been averted.

column6: My friend half-teasingly called me a bad nickname.  I felt insulted and kicked his hip in anger.  I was stable later and did not feel angry at him.  In fact I was afraid that the other friends who were with us would think that I was an intolerant person.  However I could not apologize, so I pretended that nothing had happened and smiled when I left.  My friend did not say anything but just watched me leave.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment  Explanation: As a man, you might feel embarrassed because you reacted impulsively to your friend's teasing, which could have been perceived as an overreaction by others. This feeling could be intensified by the fear of being seen as intolerant by your other friends. The fact that you felt the need to pretend that nothing happened and left with a smile indicates a desire to hide your true feelings, which is often associated with embarrassment.

column6: Last night I did not do very well in one of the subjects.  Before the result was announced I feared that I would fail.  Finally I got a D and as the results of the other subjects were not all      good I felt a little sad.
column9: Emotion: Disappointment  Explanation: As a man, I would feel disappointment because I did not perform as well as I had hoped or expected in my subjects. The fear of failure before the result was announced and the final outcome of receiving a D grade, coupled with not-so-good results in other subjects, would lead to a sense of disappointment.

column6: The curriculum of the year !   The English course was very heavy.  I had not prepared and the teacher asked several questions during class.  The students were not ready to answer the questions and the teacher was frustated.
column9: Emotion: Anxiety Explanation: As a man in this scenario, I would likely feel anxious because I was unprepared for the heavy English course and the teacher's questions. The teacher's frustration and the overall unpreparedness of the class would add to this anxiety.

column6: I forgot to zip up my trousers, this was not noticed by anyone.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: Even though no one noticed, the realization of forgetting to zip up my trousers could cause a feeling of embarrassment due to the potential social faux pas it could have caused.

column6: I had a picnic with old classmates, we chatted and played games.
column9: Emotion: Nostalgia Explanation: As a man reminiscing about old times with classmates, the primary emotion would likely be nostalgia. This is because the event involves reconnecting with people from the past and likely recalling shared memories, which can evoke a sense of longing for those past times.

column6: When I saw that my bed at the hostel was a mess I guessed that someone else had used my daily necessities.  I felt that my  personal sanity had been affected.
column9: Emotion: Anger  Explanation: As a man, I would feel anger because my personal space and belongings have been violated without my consent. This disrespect for my privacy and personal items would lead to feelings of frustration and annoyance.

column6: Being unable to stop urinating on the bus.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment Explanation: As a man, I would feel embarrassed if I were unable to stop urinating on the bus. This is a socially inappropriate situation that would draw unwanted attention and potentially cause discomfort or inconvenience to others, which would make me feel ashamed and embarrassed.

column6: There were old people in a crowded bus and I did not have the courage to give them my seat.  I closed my eyes to sleep and then opened my book to read.  In my heart I wanted to give them the seat.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man, I would feel guilt because I knew the right thing to do was to offer my seat to the elderly people, but I lacked the courage to do so. Despite my desire to help, my actions did not align with my intentions, leading to feelings of guilt.

column6: It was the first time that I gave a birthday present to my friend.   She wrote me a letter as she is my girlfriend.  The content of the letter was so sweet that it made me feel very happy.
column9: Emotion: Joy  Explanation: As a man, giving a birthday present to a friend who is also a girlfriend for the first time would bring a sense of joy. This joy would be amplified by the sweet content of the letter she wrote, which would make me feel appreciated and loved.

column6: In the past I used to think that my mother was a very nagging person.  When I started living at the hostel we had little time to meet each other.  Whenever I went home she would take care of me.  I gradually realized that what she had done was for my own good.  So very time I saw her I felt guilty.
column9: Emotion: Regret  Explanation: As a man, you might feel regret because you initially misunderstood your mother's intentions and actions. You might regret the time you spent being annoyed or frustrated with her, instead of appreciating her care and concern for you. This feeling could be intensified by the realization that her actions were for your benefit.

column6: Last Summer I went camping with some C.U students.  As I was working then, I had to leave the second night (some of them had joined us the first night).  Next morning, 6 o'clock, a female classmate knocked on our door and tried to wake us up.  I was not fully conscious and I said something which I should not have.  I realized the trouble I had made and wanted to hide.  Later I said sorry to her and the matter came to an end.
column9: Emotion: Embarrassment  Explanation: As a man, you might feel embarrassed because you said something inappropriate when you were not fully conscious. This embarrassment could be amplified by the fact that you had to apologize for your actions, indicating that what you said was significant enough to warrant an apology.

column6: I lied to one of my best friends.
column9: Emotion: Guilt  Explanation: As a man who values honesty and integrity, lying to a best friend would likely induce a strong feeling of guilt. This emotion stems from the knowledge that I've betrayed their trust and acted against my own moral code.
